Either they can get locomotive pilot and guard from the railways or they can bring their staff who would be given training by the railways.”Railway board has also started the process of request for quote (RFQ) seeking applications from various private players for running these trains. Also, these trains would be given a priority to maintain their punctuality. “They were given time slots to operate. Railways will ensure that they will not coincide with the time slots given to the trains like Shatabdi Express, Rajdhani Express and other superfast trains run by the railways,” said an officer.

Title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on 2-day visit to Delhi
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Bihar CM Nitish Kumar

PATNA: Bihar chief minister (CM) and JD(U) president Nitish Kumar went on a two-day trip to Delhi on Saturday.

According to sources in the JD(U), Nitish attended the wedding reception of Rohan Jaitley, the son of former Union minister Arun Jaitley, in the national capital in the evening.

The CM had unveiled a life-size statue of Jaitley at Park no. 31 in Kankarbagh area of the state capital on December 28 last year on the occasion of the latter’s birth anniversary. Jaitley’s wife Sangeeta, daughter Sonali and son Rohan were also present during the event.

On Sunday, Nitish will address a national convention on ‘Liquor-free India’ at the ISKCON auditorium in Delhi. Being organised by the Milita Odisha Nisha Nibarana Abhiyan, the convention will be presided over by Rajya Sabha deputy chairman and JD(U) MP Harivansh Narayan.

Union minister of state for animal husbandry and dairying Pratap Chandra Sarangi, social activist Radha Bhatt, Acharya Santoshananda and representatives of the CMs of Mizoram and Andhra Pradesh will also address the convention, which is being organized with an aim to give a nationwide call for prohibition.

Prohibition was implemented in Bihar on April 5, 2016.

Title: Surat: Mumbai teen kidnaps 16-year-old US girl on India visit, held
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: Varachha police arrested an 18-year-old Mumbai boy on Saturday for allegedly kidnapping a 16-year-old US citizen from Varachha area of the city.

Police arrested Ashish alias Aeron Chunj in Varachha for kindapping the girl. The accused is resident of Parel in Mumbai and is a native of Haryana.

According to cops, the duo developed friendship through Instagram and Facebook a few months ago and planned to meet. He asked her to come to Mumbai and accordingly the girl disappeared from the house of a relative, where the US family was staying.

Police got her medical examination done to ascertain if she had been sexually assaulted before reuniting her with the family. Police are yet to disclose the findings of the medical examination.

The minor is from New Jersey and had come to India with her family to attend a wedding in the city. Her parents are originally from Saurashtra and had migrated to the US a few years ago. Her father works in a store and this was the girl’s second visit to India.

"The duo informed the police that they met on Facebook and became friends. The accused asked her if she wanted to come to Mumbai, after which she disappeared," said an officer in Varachha police station.

Sources in police informed that the accused was in the city for the past couple of days and had met the girl on the previous night during a garba event. She returned home at around 1.30am and then disappeared. Examination of CCTV footage revealed that the youth had come to pick her up from the relative’s home.

Title: Bihar: JD(U) hits out at Tejashwi Yadav for planning ‘shahi yatra’
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Tejashwi Prasad Yadav

PATNA: JD(U) functionary and state information and public relations department minister (IPRD) Neeraj Kumar on Saturday raised questions over the swanky customized bus which the leader of opposition in state assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav will use during his ‘Berojgari Hatao Yatra’ scheduled to begin from February 23.

Neeraj showed various documents to media persons to establish that the bus was registered in the name of a person belonging to BPL category. However, the mobile number in the document was that of a former RJD MLA, he said.

Neeraj said the bus was registered with state transport department in the name of one Magal Pal on November 29 last year, but contact number of the owner was that of former RJD MLA Anirudh Yadav.

Neeraj said Pal was a resident of Hidayatpur village in Bakhtiyarpur and belonged to extremely backward caste. He even presented documents showing Pal’s approval by the block development officer and deputy development commissioner in February 2008 to be included on the BPL list.

“While Mangal Pal is a poor man, Anirudh is a former RJD MLA and a muscleman. RJD has done another fraud and Tejashwi should explain how a poor person could afford such hi-tech bus,” the IPRD minister said.

Describing Tejashwi’s yatra as ‘ shahi yatra ’, Neeraj said while RJD chief Lalu Prasad believed in land deals, his son has turned hi-tech to boost family’s benami property.

However, RJD spokesperson Mritunjay Tiwari said the JD(U) and BJP leaders were nervous before Tejashwi’s yatra and trying to divert people’s attention from the main issue of unemployment. “They have been ruling the state for past 15 years just by blaming Laluji. Such tricks will not work anymore. We have hired this bus and since they are in government, they can do the investigation,” Tiwari added.

Lalu’s son to address public meet today: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in state assembly Tejashwi Prasad will hold public meetings at Madhubani and Purnia for three consecutive from Sunday, his close aide Sanjay Yadav said. “Tejashwi will raise issues like CAA, NRC, health, education and unemployment at the meetings. On Sunday, he will address a gathering at Pyare Ram Swaroop Uchcha Vidyalaya at Korahiya in Madhubani. He is also scheduled to address public meetings at Bisfi Intermediate School in Madhubani on Monday and Vaisi in Purnia on Tuesday,” Yadav said.

Title: Niyojit teachers trying to blackmail government: Bihar education minister
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Bihar education minister Krishna Nandan Prasad Verma

Title: Seek traffic SP’s nod before digging Patna roads: Administration
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

An open ditch on Baripath road near Makhnia Kuan in Patna

PATNA: Divisional commissioner Sanjay Kumar Agarwal has issued a slew of directives to prevent damages caused due to digging of roads in the city.

In a meeting held at his office on Saturday, Agarwal pointed out that the Bihar Urban Infrastructure Development Corporation (BUIDCo), the Gas Authority of India Limited (GAIL) or any other agency would now have to take written permission from Patna traffic SP Amarkesh D and municipal commissioner Amit Kumar Pandey as well as a no-objection certificate (NoC) from the road construction department for digging up roads.

The traffic SP, municipal commissioner, executives of the GAIL and other officials attended the meet.

According to a press statement issued by the office of the divisional commissioner, the instruction for taking prior permission from the traffic SP and the municipal commissioner was issued based on their feedback as well as the complaints of the common people. The two officials said in the meeting that the GAIL and the BUIDCo had dug up roads for carrying out underground works without informing them.

It was also decided that permission for digging up a new stretch would be granted only after a previously dug up road was filled up and black-topped.

“The work will have to be completed within a given time frame so that vehicular movement is not affected for long. Besides, roads will be dug up only at night even if the agency concerned has to rope in additional manpower,” the statement said and added that lawful action would be taken against the agencies that violate the instructions.

In order to ensure smooth vehicular movement, the divisional commissioner asked Amarkesh D to depute additional traffic constables in areas where roads were being dug up. He was also told to make sure that the GAIL and the BUIDCo did not close any road for digging it up without permission.

Those present in Saturday’s meeting were directed to monitor the digging of roads in the city and hold meetings on the first and fifteenth days of every month.

Title: Kochi: Man held for sexually abusing girl
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Representative image

KOCHI: A 40-year-old man was arrested under the Pocso Act for sexually abusing a 14-year-old girl.

The arrested person has been identified as Binil Kunnumpurath of Parppakode, Edakattuvayal. The accused had sexually assaulted the girl at her house and in the house of the accused, multiple times.

The accused had threatened the girl with dire consequences, including physical hurt, if she revealed her ordeal to anyone. The scared teen kept her sufferings to herself.

However, the teachers at the girl’s school, who noticed a change in her behaviour, provided her counselling. The girl revealed the incidents to the counsellor leading to the police getting intimated about it. The accused was charged under relevant Sections of the Pocso Act by Mulanthuruthy police.

Officials said that the accused has confessed to the crime. He was presented in court and was remanded in judicial custody.

Title: Shun junk food to lead a healthy life: Experts
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

PATNA: Improper lifestyle and intake to junk food has led to increase in colorectal diseases, including intestinal cancer problem, constipation and rectal collapse, especially in the youngsters, experts said at a continuing medical education (CME) programme on ‘Controversies in colorectal disease’ at Indira Gandhi Institute of Medical Sciences (IGMIS) on Saturday.

IGIMS superintendent Dr Manish Mandal said there had been increase in the cases of patients coming with problem of large intestine and rectum. “This is mostly found in youngsters in Bihar and is more painful than constipation. It is mainly caused by fast food and western food style,” he added. Dr UC Ghoshal of Sanjay Gandhi Postgraduate Institute of Medical Sciences said almost 50% of people suffer from constipation problem these days.

Gastro head of Sanjay Gandhi Postgraduate Institute of Medical Sciences Dr Ashok Kumar said there was also an increase in intestinal cancer cases due to intake of improper food. “Constipation could be the result of being addicted to television, computers and mobile phones,” he said. Dr Abhijeet Chandra of King George’s Medical University talked about rectal prolapse and its surgery.

The event was inaugurated by state health department director-in-chief (administration) Dr Ashok Kumar Singh.

Title: Shots fired near anti-CAA protest site
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

PATNA: Police have detained two suspects for interrogation in connection with firing near an anti-CAA dharna site at Ishanagar Petrol Line under the Phulwarisharif police station area in the city late on Friday night. However, nobody was injured in the firing.

The incident took place around 10.15pm when the people staging dharna to protest CAA and NRC were about to depart from the spot. While one shot was fired close to the dharna site, another round was fired about 200 metres away from there. One empty cartridge was seized from the spot.

SHO of Phulwarisharif police station Rafiq-ur-Rahman said two youths riding a motorcycle reached the spot and opened fire in the air. Another shot was fired from a place close to the dharna site causing panic among the protesters. Those involved in the firing later fled towards Ishapur Rai Chowk.

“We are trying to collect footages of CCTV cameras installed at nearby shops and business establishments to identify the miscreants involved in the firing. A complaint has been lodged on the statement of a police officer,” the SHO said.

The dharna to oppose the CAA and NRC entered 29th day at Phulwarisharif on Saturday. People from a particular community come to the site in the morning and leave around 10pm.

Patrolling has been intensified in the locality following Friday’s incident. “We are frightened after the firing. We demand more protection for the people taking part in the protests against the CAA and NRC,” said a CPI-ML (Liberation) activist preferring anonymity.

The SHO said all precautionary measures were taken to ensure safety of protesters. “There is no need to worry for them,” he added.

Earlier, violent clashes had taken place between pro-CAA and anti-CAA supporters near Tamtam Parao under the Phulwarisharif police station area during dawn to dusk bandh on December 23 last year. The firing led to bullet injuries to about 12 protesters and a youth’s body was later found from a well in the locality. Over 60 people were arrested from two different communities in connection with the violent clashes.

Title: BJP MP’s yajna in ‘interest of nation’
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

SASARAM: In a unique way of showing support to CAA and NRC, BJP’s Sasaram unit organised a ‘buddhi-suddhi yajna’ at a Lord Shiva temple near the tomb of Sher Shah Suri here on Saturday.

Sasaram MP Chedi Pasawan, who led the yajna, said it was organised with a view to purifying the minds of the people protesting against the CAA and NPR.

The four-time MP said the yajna was organised in the interest of the nation and no one would be deprived of their citizenship. “Some people are creating confusion over the citizenship laws for their vested interests,” he said.

The yajna, which lasted for three hours, was attended by BJP’s Rohtas district unit president Sushil Kumar, former MLA Jawahar Prasad and around 50 party workers.

According to sources, the yajna started on Saturday morning with rituals in five ‘havan kunds’ performed by five priests. Party workers and MP Pasawan chanted ‘Bharat mata ki Jai’ during the yajna.

Asked about the outcome of yajna, Paswan said the Gods have ushered their blessing and it will help in purifying the minds of the people protesting against CAA.

Title: Laskana powerloom units remain shut since worker’s death week ago
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Surat: Production at Laskana industrial estate , located 20 kilometres away from the city on Surat-Kamrej Road, has come to a grinding halt. About 400 powerloom units remain shut for last one week after the death of an Oriya worker in one of the units located in Krishna industrial estate.

Industry sources said some anti-social elements in the guise of union leaders are trying to take undue advantage of the incident that occurred on February 7. Majority of powerloom units shut down from the very next day. Laskana’s 400 units employ more than 30,000 workers. The industrial area manufactures about 15 lakh metres of polyester fabric per day. Powerloom weavers in Laskana stated that majority of workers employed in the industrial societies are from Odisha and Bihar. The anti-social elements instigated workers to abstain from work as the unit owner was not paying compensation to family of the deceased worker.

Praful Panna Sheti, 50, a textile worker employed in a powerloom unit owned by Mayur Vaghasia in Krishna industrial estate, had died of heart attack on February 7. A group of anti-social elements protested outside the unit of Vaghasia and demanded Rs10 lakh compensation for his family.

Vaghasia told TOI, “The worker died a natural death. We offered to pay Rs2 lakh compensation to his family, but the union leaders demanded Rs10 lakh. They distributed pamphlets in Oriya language asking workers to not go to their units.”

Laskana Powerloom Weavers’ Association president Hari Kathiria told TOI, “The entire powerloom industry in Laskana has come to a standstill. The anti-social elements are demanding hefty compensation for the worker who died a natural death, which is unfair. When we didn’t accept their demands, they forced workers not to go to their units.”

Federation of Gujarat Weavers’ Association (FOGWA) president Ashok Jirawala said, “We fear such incidents will disturb peace in other powerloom industrial areas. A group of anti-social elements is trying to disturb peace in the industry. The association will be writing to the chief minister demanding protection for industrial areas from such elements.”

PHOTO QUOTES

Vijay Mangukiya, president of Anjani industrial estate, said: The death of worker is unfortunate, but the anti-social elements are going to destroy the industry forever. We are doing business and providing employment to workers from other states, still we have to face losses due to unnecessary closures.

Mayur Golwala, leader of powerloom weaving sector, said: There is a sense of fear among powerloom weavers. If there is one or two unions, we are ready to sort out the issue through talks. But, here we have several groups approaching us for settlement. Many weavers in Laskana and outer areas are fed up and looking to shift their units to other places.

Title: Document registration at Kumbharia office to go online
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Surat: There is good news for residents of Surat as the registration process for their documents at city’s Kumbharia sub-registrar’s office is set to go online from next month. People will not need to go to the sub-registrar’s office to take token for document registration. They will need to get from March 2 onwards prior online appointment at their preferred time and date through https://garvi.gujarat.gov.in. This they would be able to do by going to online appointment scheduler menu and providing details about themselves like their names, addresses , mobile numbers , e-mail IDs etc.

The Kumbharia sub-registrar office is one of the eight sub-registrar offices in the state where this pilot project is being implemented. Government officials say only people with prior online appointments will be entertained at these sub-registrar offices.

“In 2019, total 6,373 documents were registered at Kumbharia sub-registrar office,’’ an officer said.

Surat district has 18 sub-registrar offices at Palsana, Choryasi, Udhana, Surat city-1, Olpad, Bardoli, Mangrol, Umarpada, Hazira, Nanpura, Althan, Mahuva, Mandvi, Navagam, Rander and three other places.

Title: Airmen recruitment rally will be held in Surat in two batches
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Surat: Indian Air Force (IAF) will organize a recruitment rally for airmen (non-technical) medical assistant trade in group Y on February 17 and 19 in the city. Physical test for airmen will be held between 6am and 10am at Veer Narmad Daxin Gujarat University (Udhna Magdulla Road) at Vesu by Central Airmen Selection Board, a release said. The candidates should be 12th pass in science stream and will have to first register their names online.

The first test will be held on February 17 for candidates from Amreli, Rajkot, Bhavnagar, Botad, Dwarka, Gir-Somnath, Morbi, Jamnagar, Junagadh, Surendranagar, Kutch, Gandhinagar, Porbandar, Ahmedabad, Mehsana, and the Union territories of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu.

On 19 February, the test will be held for candidates from Surat, Anand, Chhota-Udepur, Dahod, Mahisagar, Panchmahal, Aravali, Banaskantha, Patan, Vadodara, Sabarkantha, Bharuch, Dang, Narmada, Tapi, Valsad, Navsari and Kheda, it added.

Title: 1,500-strong Khilafat rally makes way to Park Circus
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Kolkata: More than 1,500 people marched in a silent rally organized by Calcutta Khilafat Committee on Saturday afternoon to protest against the amended citizenship law. Participants carried the National flag, wore black bands and many held up posters against CAA and NRC. As the rally proceeded to Park Circus from Zakaria Street, several people joined in.

Calcutta Khilafat Committee, which was formed a century ago to unite Hindus and Muslims against the British, had kept itself away from socio-political movements after Independence. It was mainly instrumental in organizing the Eid prayers on Red Road and organizing cultural functions. The committee has also faced a lot of criticism for keeping silent even after so many people started hitting the streets in protest.

“Saturday’s rally was our first initiative against the citizenship law. Besides organizing such protest marches, we are also going to provide legal and moral support to other protesters. We have set up a legal cell for this purpose,” said Mullick Mohammad Ishaque, convenor, Calcutta Khilafat Committee.

The procession had participants from several communities. “This movement is not restricted to any community. Anybody who is protesting in any which way must forge alliance with the people around them. This is essential to send a message to the Prime Minister and the home minister that the citizens are against this new law,” said Qari Fazlu Rahman, who leads the Eid prayers on Red Road every year.

The committee is also planning to engage in a dialogue with the intelligentsia from other communities to convey the fears of the people regarding CAA, NPR and NRC.

Title: Textile firm owner held in Rs 3.5cr bogus billing racket
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Surat: The intelligence unit of the State Goods and Service Tax (SGST) department has busted a fake GST invoice racket to the tune of Rs 3.57 crore and arrested a man who fraudulently claimed refund Input Tax Credit (ITC) under the Integrated Goods and Service Tax (IGST) without the actual supply of goods.

Anil Natha Hirpara, who owns three textile firms, was arrested under section 69 of the GST Act for fraudulently claiming ITC worth Rs 3.57 crore without the actual supply of goods.

The department officials had carried out searches at the offices of the three textile firms located in Sarthana and Varachha areas of the city few days ago. Incriminating documents and bogus invoices were recovered from the premises.

According to the SGST department, the accused owns three firms namely—Khushi Impex, Sai Fashion and Bhojal creations—located in the city. The firms were involved in getting fake bills without the actual supply of goods from the shell firms located in Gujarat and Maharashtra.

The firms opened by Hirpara procured bogus invoices worth Rs 15 crore from the shell firms without the actual supply of goods. The owner indulged in the overvaluation of the goods for claiming the refund of IGST under the ITC worth Rs 3.57 crore.

Sources said that the accused was presented in the Chief Judicial Magistrate court in the city on Saturday where he was remanded in the judicial custody till February 28.

Title: Surat: Gold dust worth Rs 1.4 crore stolen
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Video grab of two accused while committing the crime

SURAT: Three unidentified persons were booked at Varachha police station for stealing 4.4kg gold dust worth Rs1.42 crore from a gold and diamond jewellery unit in the city on Saturday. Police suspect role of an insider in the theft since only he would know where the gold dust was being collected.

The gold dust is collected in a plastic bag placed under jewellery grinding machines through vacuum suction during the process of jewellery polishing. The burglars escaped with these bags which were full of gold dust after removing them from the machines.

Of the three burglars, two had entered the unit while one waited outside. The burglars were caught by CCTV cameras entering Dazzle Jewels at 1.10am and leaving at 2.40am. The complaint was lodged by Keyur Patel, a resident of Alkapuri on Sumul Dairy Road. Dazzle Jewels, which employs 125 people, manufactures diamond and gold jewellery.

Every 15 days, the unit replaces the bags and recycles the gold dust for jewellery making. It is suspected that the burglars stole the bags on the 15th day of the month.

"The unit owners change the bags that collect gold dust twice in a month. The unit maintains exact log of the gold dust collected in that period. The owners claim approximately 4.462kg gold dust has been stolen," said an officer of Varachha police station.

The faces of the burglars were covered and they are yet to be identified. "Two persons entered the unit and we suspect more than two were involved in the theft. We are working to identify the individuals involved and the route they took to come to the unit and escape,” police said.

Investigators are also checking if any former or current employee was involved. So far, they haven’t got any leads.

Title: Bihar: 15 lakh to write Matric exams from Monday
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: Altogether 15,29,393 students, including 7,83,034 girls, will appear for the Matriculation (Class X) examinations from Monday. The exams , which are conducted by the Bihar School Examination Board (BSEB) in two shifts, will begin with the science paper at 1,368 centres across the state.

BSEB chairman Anand Kishor on Saturday urged the students to avoid rumours related to the leak of question papers. “The Board has prepared 10 different sets of question papers. Therefore, there is no chance of leak,” Kishor said, adding students won’t know which set of questions they get in the examination.

Addressing mediapersons here at Board office, Kishor pointed out that instructions have been issued to the DMs, DEOs, centre superintendents and security personnel to ensure that no unfair means are being used during the exams. “Students will be frisked twice before entering the examination hall. They have also been asked not to wear shoes and socks at the centre. Electronic devices and gadgets are also restricted,” he said.

The officials concerned have been asked to enforce Section 144 of the Criminal Procedure Code (CrPC) in a radius of 200m around the examination centres to prevent gatherings.

The chairman pointed out that there will be one invigilator for every 25 students and a videographer for 500 students. “All the examination centres are equipped with closed-circuit television cameras,” he said and added candidates can only carry their admit card and a pen to the centre.

Besides, students will get OMR sheets for writing objective-type questions and use of whitener will be prohibited. If caught, their copies will be rejected.

The Board has set up control rooms in each district and issued helpline numbers to register complaints related to exams.

Kishor also appealed to the candidates to reach the centre 10 minutes before the commencement of examination to avoid last-minute hassles.

Title: Bihar government to introduce new e-tendering process in April: Sushil Kumar Modi
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Sushil Kumar Modi

PATNA: Deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi on Saturday said the government would introduce new e-tendering module from April this year for greater transparency in the processing of tenders submitted by contractors and executing agencies for their selection and allotment of work.

Modi was addressing the pre-budget consultative meeting involving contractors and representatives of agencies. Building construction department minister Ashok Choudhary , public health and engineering department minister Vinod Narayan Jha and water resources department minister Sanjay Kumar Jha were also present on the occasion.

Modi dwelt on various other aspects related to the tendering process on which the government has been working for introduction in the future. Even as contractors might be seeking work allotment in various works departments, including the road construction department, their registration with the government would be done at one place.

He added that prior to the submission of tender and preparation of the estimate of work sought for, they would be provided with a checklist which would mention the laws and other aspects with which they would have to comply during the preparation of the estimate or the execution of work.

Modi said documents submitted during the filing of tenders would be put on display on the official portal for seven days as was being done in the road construction department. This would be done to give information to the tenderers about errors in the tender papers they had submitted, or the reasons for the rejection of the tenders filed by them for the work allotment.

Earlier, the participant contractors and representatives of the work executing agencies raised queries regarding Goods and Services Tax (GST) and mining activities. Modi said a workshop would be held in the near future to resolve their grievances and clear their confusions.

Modi talked about the quantum of work that had been undertaken in the current fiscal, saying that Bihar had become the biggest consumer of cement in the country. During the current fiscal, works worth Rs 31,600 crore had been taken up for execution, while raw materials worth Rs 22,146 crore had been brought into the state for use in the construction work.

The raw materials brought for use in the construction work included iron and steel worth Rs 10,600 crore, cement worth Rs 4,279 crore, electrical goods in the range of Rs 6,572 crore and tiles and marbles to the tune of Rs 675 crore.

Besides, in the 2019-20 financial year, works worth Rs 7,023 crore had been taken up for execution in the road construction department, followed by Rs 4,423 crore in the building construction department and Rs 2,662 crore in the water resources department.

Title: Kolkata: After hiding at home for years, acid attack survivor rebuilds life, set to marry soulmate
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Mamata Sarkar and Lucky Singh will tie the knot on March 10

KOLKATA: For Nadia’s acid attack survivor Mamata Sarkar and her partner, Uttarakhand’s Lucky Singh, it hasn’t always been a smooth journey. Four years ago, the scars on Sarkar’s face didn’t come in the way of Singh falling in love with “her soul” and soon, he shifted base to Kolkata to strengthen their relationship. His family, however, didn’t accept his decision to marry an acid attack survivor and disowned him.

But this Valentine’s Day, Singh decided to take up a room on rent near Sarkar’s house so that they can get married on March 10 and settle down there.

One night in 2004, when Sarkar was asleep with her mother in their bedroom, she felt a liquid splash over her face and body. “I was around 13-14. The culprit was a relative who had enmity with us over property issues. He thought the incident would bring a bad name to my family and no one would marry me. He thought I would become an unlucky burden for my family. Though I survived, my scars were devastating. The culprit got bail while I locked myself at home for over four years,” she recalled.

Four years ago, Sarkar decided to rebuild her life. She got multiple surgeries done, cleared her higher secondary exams and got a job. She met Singh when she went to Durgapur for work. “Slowly, I started liking her. I always believed that looks are skin-deep and the soul of a person needs to be beautiful. I fell in love with her soul,” 25-year-old Singh told TOI.

However, a long-distance relationship wasn’t Singh’s cup of tea. Though the company where he was working had branches across India, it folded up at the time he decided to move to Kolkata. And family opposition couldn’t change his mind. “I got a job in Kolkata just to be close to her. Though my family didn’t disrespect my decision to be in a relationship with her, they didn’t accept my decision to marry her. They disowned me,” he said.

On March 10, the couple will tie the knot at Sarkar’s house in Nadia’s Binodnagar village. “I had lost faith in love. He taught me that true love isn’t cosmetic,” Sarkar said. “He has got me a red lehenga for the wedding,” the bride-to-be added.

“I want to return to my village with her. Time and professional success, I hope, will get us acceptance,” he said.

Title: Bihar signs pact with NIMHANS to fight AES
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

A child being treated suspected symptoms of Acute Encephalitis Syndrome in Patna (File photo)

PATNA: National Institute of Mental Health and Neurosciences ( NIMHANS ), Bangalore, will provide technical support to state health department for enhancing surveillance for acute encephalitis syndrome ( AES ), which had killed over 150 children in the state last year.

NIMHANS will also strengthen the capacity of existing laboratories in the state and develop a tiered network of labs.

A memorandum of understanding (MoU) in this regard was signed between state health department and NIMHANS here on Saturday. The non-financial MoU will be effective till September this year.

As part of the MoU, NIMHANS team will provide support in strengthening district laboratories or level-1 lab where basic test can be done and two virology labs, one at Patna Medical College and Hospital and another at Darbhanga Medical College and Hospital (DMCH), will be developed as level-2 labs.

For high level test, samples will be sent to NIMHANS lab in Bangalore. Before enhancing these labs, NIMHANS and Care India will conduct a gap assessment and then suggest measures for strengthening surveillance capabilities. This gap assistance will be done in 15 days.

State health department principal secretary Sanjay Kumar after said signing the MoU that it was important to understand the reason behind AES, for which research was required and NIMHANS will be training health experts on the ways of documentation. Sanjay said many experts had earlier given various theories on AES, but its aetiology is still unknown.

NIMHANS neuro-virology head Dr V Ravi said doctors would be imparted training in March and pharmacists and lab technicians in April.

“NIMHANS has already done such surveillances in Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal and Assam. In UP, 30 to 40% of encephalitis cases were because of scrub typhus germs. Dengue was found to be another factor. In fact, causes have been found for 50% encephalitis cases in UP,” he said.

‘100-bed PIU at Muzaffarpur hospital by April’: State health department principal secretary Sanjay Kumar on Saturday said the 100-bed paediatric intensive care unit (PICU) at Sri Krishna Medical College and Hospital in Muzaffarpur would be ready by the last week of April this year.

He also said a dhramshala was being made at SKMCH to provide accommodation to the parents of sick kids. “A batch of 36 doctors and nurses has been sent to Delhi for training on AES,” Sanjay said.

Title: 25 booked for attack on Kanhaiya Kumar’s convoy
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Kanhaiya Kumar

ARA/BIHARSHARIF: Police on Saturday booked 25 people for the attack on the convoy of CPI functionary and former JNU Students’ Union president Kanhaiya Kumar at Bibiganj under Gajrajganj outpost of Bhojpur district on Friday.

The convoy of Kanhaiya, who has been holding public meetings against Citizenship (Amendment) Act and National Register of Citizens (NRC) across the state under his ‘Jan Gan Man Yatra’ since January 29, has so far been attacked for eighth time.

SHO of Gajrajganj police outpost Manish Kumar said an FIR was lodged against 10 named and 15 unknown people for the attack on Kanhaiya’s convoy. “The FIR was been lodged on the statement of an ASI, Hira Lal Rai, as he was a member of the police escort that accompanied the convoy of Kanhaiya. According to our initial investigation, mostly members of Shiv Sena or their sympathizers were behind the attack,” the SHO said.

Bhojpur SP Sushil Kumar, on the other hand, said three people have been arrested so far in connection with attack on Kanhaiya’s convoy and raids were on to nab others. “One of the arrested persons is Vikramaditya Singh, who claims to be the state organizational secretary of Shiv Sena,” the SP said.

Meanwhile, Bajrang Dal activists organised a massive candlelight match in Biharsharif on Friday night in solidarity with Pulwama martyrs and threatened Kanhaiya of dire consequences, if he made anti-national statements during his proposed visit to Nalanda on Sunday.

Nalanda district CPI general secretary Surindra Ram said tens of hundreds of people listen to Kanhaiya wherever he goes. “The overwhelming response by the people has upset the divisive forces and out of desperation, they have made at least eight abortive attempts on his life,” he said.

Kanhaiya is also scheduled to address a rally at Sheikhpura’s Islamia School Ground on Sunday.

Meanwhile, CPI’s state secretary Satya Narayan Singh on Saturday demanded “adequate security” for Kanhaiya. “Kanhaiya and other persons accompanying him have been attacked at eight places,” Singh said.

Title: Bihar: Ropeway work on Rohtasgarh, Mundeshwari hills to start soon
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: Work on installation of ropeways on Rohtasgarh hill in Rohtas and Mundeshwari hill in Kaimur district is likely to commence within a month.

The ropeway connecting Akbarpur and Rohtasgarh Fort will be 1.35km-long. “The Chorasan temple situated on the top of Rohtasgarh Hill is a major tourist attraction. The area is intended to be developed as an ecotourism site,” said Sikandar Paswan, project engineer of Bihar Rajya Pul Nirman Nigam Limited (BRPNNL).

BRPNNL is the executing agency of the project. The estimated outlay for ropeway in Rohtas and Kaimur is Rs8.34 crore and Rs5.77 crore, respectively.

Officials said altogether six ropeways are proposed at different places in the state, including three in Gaya and one each in Kaimur, Rohtas and Jehanabad districts. Sources at BRPNNL said bidding process for the other ropeways were in the initial stages.

Talking about the delay in the Rohtasgarh and Mundeshwari hill projects, a BRPNNL official said: “We were not getting a firm with the required specializations. As of now, the bidding process for ropeway system at Rohtas and Kaimur are in final stages and construction work will begin in March.”

The 425m ropeway on Mundeshwari hill will provide connectivity to Mundeshwari Dham. “Climbing 951 steps on Mundeshwari hill is not just time taking and tiring but unsafe as well. With ropeway system, tourists will be able to reach the hilltop in less than 10 minutes,” Paswan said.

Meanwhile, another BRPNNL official said: “Both Rohtas and Kaimur are located on hills and are environmentally sensitive zones. These are already established tourist destinations in the state. The districts witness vehicular movement throughout the day, causing pollution. Cable car facility on ropeway will not just be convenient for tourists but time saving too. Besides, they are eco-friendly and sustainable and most importantly sources of tourist attraction.”

Title: Srijan scam: Trader’s property attached
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Representative image

BHAGALPUR: In stern action against a beneficiary of multi-hundred crore scam related to siphoning of government money by Srijan Mahila Vikas Sahyog Samiti ( SMVSS ), the Bank of Baroda and Bhagalpur district administration have confiscated immovable property of N V Raju, an absconding trader. Raju is accused number 3 in one of the 22 FIRs lodged in connection with the scam.

A plot of land (1440 square feet) at Jogsar and one shop each of the trader at Ishwari Complex and Adhyaanti Complex in Bhagalpur town were confiscated under the Securitisation and Reconstruction of Financial Assets and Enforcement of Securities Interest Act, 2002 (also known as the SARFAESI Act).

The seized properties were under mortgage with Bank of Baroda (BOB) against a loan of Rs 1.55 crore, whose present value is Rs 1.88 crore.

BOB panel lawyer Keshav Kumar Jha said confiscation of three immovable properties were made under SARFAESI Act, allowing banks and other financial institutions to auction residential or commercial properties (of defaulter) to recover loans.

Special magistrate Manikant Prasad Gupta, who executed the confiscation and sealing process of the immovable property of N V Raju, said it was done as per law.

Sources said Raju was under the scanner of CBI, income-tax department and Economic Offences Unit (EOU) of Bihar police as well as banks and other agencies since the Rs 1,910-crore Srijan scam came to light in August 2017.

Raju, who was earlier a small time sales representative with a private firm, is presently a big dealer of electronics items. According to sources, Raju took loans from BOB and went underground after the scam surfaced. The BOB authorities recently approached Bhagalpur DM Pranav Kumar to initiate confiscation of his property and put it on auction to recover the bank money.

Title: Plea to set up institute of demography
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

PATNA: A three-day national seminar on ‘Population, Health and Sustainable Development Goals: Performance and Prioritizing Policies’, which was jointly organized by Patna University (PU) and the International Institute for Population Sciences (IIPS), concluded here on Saturday.

Delivering the valedictory address, health department principal secretary Sanjay Kumar observed that a national-level institute of demography was urgently required in the state as its total fertility rate (TFR) was 3.2 against the national average of 2.1. “This is mainly due to low acceptance of family planning measures by the people on account of poor awareness. Such an institute may be set up under the umbrella of PU,” he said.

Kumar added, “Low age of marriage and little age gap between two children are leading to unwarranted population growth. A woman usually gives birth to three children till she attains the age of 24 and the rate of male vasectomy is almost nil in Bihar .”

PU vice-chancellor Rash Bihari Prasad Singh, in his presidential remarks, highlighted the importance of demographic studies in socio-economic development of the country. He lauded the progress of the Population Research Centre attached to PU’s statistics department and assured of his full cooperation in its development.

Two papers on ‘Neglected Cause of Morbidity’ and ‘Consanguineous Marriages and Their Impact on Neonatal and Child Mortality in India’ were awarded the first and second prizes on the occasion.

D A Nagdeve of IIPS proposed the vote of thanks.

Title: Lake Gardens gets capsule pumping station
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Representative image

KOLKATA: It was a dream come true for members of Lake Gardens People ’s Association when mayor Firhad Hakim inaugurated a capsule water booster pumping station at Bangur Park on Saturday evening. This pumping station, with a capacity to supply 18 lakh gallons of filtered water every day, will cater to more than 10,000 people staying at Lake Gardens and its adjacent areas.

The water movement in the locality had started nine years ago. Amit Mukherjee, one of members of the Lake Gardens People’s Association, recalled, “We started a movement for safe and pure water as the only source of drinking water here was under ground. We were scared of drinking it for fear of arsenic contamination. Now we are happy that the KMC has set up a booster pumping station that will supply us with safe filtered water.”

“We had to shift our Durga Puja to a corner of the park to accommodate the water booster pumping station. But we are happy to have got the pumping station,” Mukherjee added.

Sources in the water supply department said the newly built booster pumping station will be able to supply filtered water from next month.

Title: After Vishnu Dutt Sharma's appointment as MP BJP chief, Delhi man flooded with ‘badhai’ calls
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Sagar Khare

BHOPAL: Khajuraho MP Vishnu Dutt Sharma’s appointment as Madhya Pradesh BJP chief has turned into a headache — or ear ache — for a Delhiite, who got hundreds of congratulatory calls all of Saturday. He has the same phone number that Sharma once used.

Sagar Khare, 24, a resident of Saroj Nagar in New Delhi, said his phone “went berserk” on Saturday afternoon. “It kept ringing. There were hundreds of WhatsApp messages,” he told TOI over phone. “I had taken this phone number around a year ago after my father’s death. Earlier, I used a number that was in the name of my father,” said Sagar, adding that it was an “ordinary number”. “I work in a salon and distributed it among my customers, friends and family members. But soon I started receiving calls and messages from unknown numbers.”

“I complained about it to customer care, and they assured me that I would not receive such calls, but to no avail. I do not mind one or two calls a day, but today I have received hundreds of calls. They just don’t stop coming,” he said. He found out that several popular caller identification apps also list his number as V D Sharma’s.

Weekends are busy and he couldn’t take all the calls, he said. “There is a huge pile of missed calls. However, I can’t avoid taking calls because it may be from a client or an acquaintance. Today, all the calls began with ‘badhai ho...’. I keep telling them politely that I am not the person they want to congratulate,” he said. “I will again complain to customer care and urge them to find a way out.”

Asked if he knows Sharma, Saroj said, “I do not know him personally, but from the calls I assume he is an important political leader.”

Title: Minister garlands Ambedkar statue, CPI men ‘purify’ it
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

BEGUSARAI: In a bizarre incident, a group of CPI workers on Saturday “purified” a statue of B R Ambedkar by washing it with ‘Gangajal’ after it was garlanded by Union minister and Begusarai MP Giriraj Singh.

The CPI workers sprinkled ‘Gangajal’ on the statue amid chants of ‘Jai Bhim’ and slogans in praise of Phule (the 19th century social reformer couple Jyotiba and Savitribai) before washing the sculpture thoroughly.

The statue, installed on the premises of Ballia block office, was garlanded by Giriraj while he was participating in a procession organised by local BJP and Bajrang Dal activists on Friday.

Local CPI leaders alleged that Giriraj, while addressing a public meet at the venue, used highly objectionable, provocative and communal language, throwing all constitutional obligations to wind.

“His speech spread communal hatred and CPI workers as a gesture washed Baba Saheb’s statue to rid it from the inauspicious touch of the minister,” CPI district working general secretary Awadhes Rai said.

He claimed that they also wrote to CM Nitish Kumar and chief secretary Deepak Kumar as well as DGP Gupteshwar Pandey, asking them to lodge criminal cases against Giriraj for his provocative speeches on Friday.

Meanwhile, BJP’s former Begusarai district president Sanjay Singh said the ‘Bharat Vanshi Jagriti Yatra’ led by the Union minister was only intended to make people aware about the rich religious legacy of India.

BJP’s state spokesperson Nikhil Anand said, “Giriraj has all the right to pay tribute by garlanding the statue of Ambedkar. The act of purification of the statue by the communists and RJD is very shameful and condemnable. They must know that Ambedkar belongs to every Indian and it is not the Congress but our PM Narendra Modi who has developed the ‘panch tirth’ places in the memory of the Father of Indian Constitution.”

Title: Two more CNG stations in city made functional
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

PATNA: Two new compressed natural gas (CNG) stations of the Gas Authority of India Limited (GAIL) were inaugurated in Naubatpur and Saguna Mor area of Patna on Saturday.

During inspection, transport secretary Sanjay Kumar Agarwal claimed that three more CNG stations would come up in a couple of months in areas like Gola Road and Digha.

“Apart from these, the interstate bus terminal, which is under construction at Ramchak Bairiya, and the proposed transport complex at Phulwarisharif will also get CNG stations. Besides, lands in other locations like Gandhi Maidan and Bailey Road are being identified for such stations,” the transport secretary said and added that altogether 12 CNG stations would be ready in the city by December-end.

At present, three CNG stations are operational at Rukanpura, Transport Nagar and Bakhtiyarpur toll plaza in Patna. The gas supply is done under the City Gas Distribution Scheme, which was launched by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Begusarai on February 17 last year.

Agarwal said, “We have been promoting the use of CNG as it is an eco-friendly fuel that can help reduce the levels of pollution. It is also cheaper than petrol and diesel. The state government also introduced 50% rebate on road tax for CNG vehicles.”

According to sources, more than 5,000 vehicles, most of which are autorickshaws, are running on CNG in Patna. The remaining 15,000 autos run on diesel and petrol.

GAIL’s deputy general manager (Patna region) Rajneesh Goel told this newspaper that the daily consumption of CNG in the state capital was 11,000kg, at present. “Approximately 3,000 vehicles refill their tankers at the three CNG stations every day,” he added.

Last year, the state government had decided to ban diesel-run autos in Patna from January 31, 2021 and its adjoining areas from March 31, 2021.

Title: Four arrested for fomenting riot
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Surat: Sarthana police arrested four persons and booked 25 others on Saturday on charges of their alleged attempt to incite riot in an industrial area over the death of a labourer. The workers took to streets on Friday night at around 10.30 pm and circulated handbills in Odiya language in Diamond Nagar, a cluster of textile weaving units , and forced the labourers to stop work while hurling abuses.

Police arrested four labourers – Santosh Dalabehra, Subrot Jena, Onadi Khutiya and Mohan Reddy – for allegedly provoking the labourers and creating disturbance in the area. The complaint was lodged by Babu Sojitra, one of the unit owners in Diamond Nagar.

Police investigation so far revealed that a 41-year-old labourer died of heart attack on February 7 while working in a textile unit in Diamond Nagar in Laskana, an area in outskirts of the city. His relatives demanded compensation from the employer, while the body was sent for cremation to Odisha. When the discussion for compensation failed, the labourers created disturbance in the area.

“Kin demanded around Rs 7 lakh while the employer proposed to give Rs 2 lakh. Following failure to get the expected amount, the labourers started creating nuisance,” said a officer in Sarthana police station.

“Though the issue of compensation does not come under police's purview, police took immediate action as they started creating disturbance forcing other labourers to go on strike leading to riots. While the leaders are yet to be identified, the situation is normal now,” police said.

Title: $5 trillion economy achievable but with ‘difficulties’: Experts
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Surat: India can achieve $5 trillion economy but the path may be difficult, said experts who attended the two-day seminar organized by the Institute of Cost Accountants of India (ICAI) on ‘Role of Certified Management Accountants (CMAs) in Withstanding Economic Challenges’ in Surat on Saturday.

“Some experts opine this target can be achieved. Services sector could contribute $3 trillion and one each from agriculture and manufacturing,” said ICAI President Balwinder Singh, commenting on the union government’s ambitions target for next five years.

Concurring his view South Gujarat Chapter Secretary and Regional Cost Convention (RCC) Co-ordinator Nanty Shah said, “There could be many obstacles in a globalized world, particularly intense competition from China.”

The seminar was inaugurated by BJP MP from Navsari C R Paatil.

Title: Slain gangster Marathi's men were in touch with attackers
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Surat: Police investigation in gangster Surya Marathi alias Suresh Pawar and his former aide Hardik Patel's murders revealed that the former’s close associates were in contact with the assailants. Patel along with his six associates had rushed into Marathi's office on Ved Road on Wednesday at around 1.22pm and stabbed him. Patel suffered serious injuries near his private parts during the attack and he collapsed a kilometre away on road while escaping. Police suspect Marathi had stabbed Patel in self- defence. Both died in hospitals. Police had detained five people of Marathi gang and call data analysis of one of them revealed these details.

Meanwhile, police produced Satish alias Satya alias Babu Marathi Dhagde, 29, and Rahul alias Apartment Piple, 24, in a local court which remanded them in police custody until February 20 on Saturday. Police had requested the court for 14 day custody for the duo arrested on Friday. These two are members of Patel gang.

Police sought custody of the accused to trace four persons who were part of the group that attacked the deceased and to recover a car and weapons. Police are also trying to find out from where the accused had purchased the new sim cards before carrying out the murder.

"Role of some other people will also come to light during investigation apart from those who had attacked Marathi. We have so far found that those present outside Marathi's office had talked to Patel," a police officer said.

Police investigation revealed that Patel and other accused involved in the murder met below Jahangirpura bridge before leaving in a car to reach the spot on Ved Road.

Title: SMC seals 160 properties over tax dues
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

SMC has urged citizens to pay their due taxes on time

Surat: Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) had sealed 160 properties and disconnected water connections of 20 properties in Pandesara, Ganpatnagar , Kshetrapal Nagar , Khatodara areas on Saturday.

South Zone (Udhana) officials of the civic body had initiated the actions after property owners failed to pay civic tax dues for the current financial year.

According to SMC officials, till now, a total of Rs 191.53 crore property tax had been collected from the zonal office and drive had been intensified to recover dues from tax defaulters.

SMC has urged citizens to pay their due taxes on time to avoid harsh actions from the civic body.

Title: Complaints about RG Kar Hospital access flood Kolkata cops’ Facebook page
Content:
A traffic cop waves vehicles forward, away from the RG Kar Hospital gate

TimesView The exam season starts from Tuesday and the traffic in this zone will severely test people’s — and traffic managers’ — patience. Responsible driving will become even more important to ensure accidents do not add to the chaos.

KOLKATA: Several steps taken by the Shyambazar traffic guard to ensure smoother vehicular flow on the Belgachhia flyover to allow easy access of ambulances and doctors to RG Kar Hospital’s emergency gate has led to several commuters — especially patients and their relatives — to appeal to cops to “reconsider them.”Their plea included allowing RG Kar Hospital-bound passengers to get off buses near the emergency gate, allowing personal vehicles of doctors on emergency the right of way and arranging a specific drop-off and pick-up spot for taxis and app cabs, most of which are now asking passengers to walk down to the Kolkata station-bound road for fear of being challaned.The cops said they are in a catch-22 situation. “The pressure is so heavy at the hospital gates that allowing even a few seconds for a bus to stop outside is leading to a major tail on the bridge. Additionally, some buses are trying to encourage passengers to disembark on the go, leading to accidents. Even with so much pressure, we have allowed passengers to get off less than 100m from the new gate beside the police kiosk, a distance most people can walk down. As of now, we have no other option as ambulances will have to be given first priority at the main gate,” explained an officer.Kolkata traffic police’s Facebook page carried specific complaints on this issue since Thursday morning, with even a doctor pitching in.“The buses are no longer stopping at RG Kar Hospital. The conductors are saying that if they stop there, sergeants will issue traffic stickers. This has now forced us — the kin of patients and local residents — to sometimes walk close to 800m from Belgachhia Metro station bus stop. The Tallah Bridge reconstruction has adversely affected us. Such a decision is making the daily commute even more difficult. I request you to look into the matter quickly,” wrote Debjani Pal, a resident of Tallah.Tanushree Roy, a doctor at RG Kar, wrote, “Due to the closure of Tallah Bridge, there is huge traffic pressure on Belgachhia flyover. The exit from RG Kar has been very difficult as cops just let the traffic flow one way from Shyambazar towards Belgachhia. It takes near about 40 minutes for a car to get to the main road from RG Kar Hospital. They even threatened my driver when I, a doctor at the hospital, pleaded about a medical emergency. Please look into the matter and ensure free flow of traffic from and towards RG Kar Medical College and Hospital .”A Lalbazar officer said they were open to “suggestions”. “We will ascertain what can be done and forward it to the guards,” said an IPS officer.

Title: ASI held on graft charge in Bihar
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: An assistant sub-inspector (ASI), Jai Kumar Singh, was arrested from Bidupur police station in Vaishali district on Saturday. He allegedly demanded Rs 12,000 as bribe from an accused in a criminal case lodged with the police station concerned.

Singh was arrested on the directive of Vaishali SP Gaurav Mangla, who had earlier received an audio clip of the ASI seeking bribe from an accused in lieu of giving him leverage in a criminal case. Preliminary investigation suggested that the allegation was true.

“The ASI was put under suspension and an FIR lodged against him on the basis of evidences. The audio clip provided by the complainant will be sent to the forensic science laboratory for voice matching test,” Mangla told mediapersons.

The arrested ASI has been booked under sections 384 and 385 of the Indian Penal Code and sections 13 (a) (d) of the Prevention of Corruption Act. “He was produced before a local court, which remanded him to judicial custody for 14 days,” Hajipur sadar DSP Raghav Dayal said.

Title: Renovation of Maurya Lok still a far cry
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

A view of pathetic condition of Mauryalok Complex in Patna on Friday

PATNA: Maurya Lok Complex, the city’s premier shopping hub, has almost lost its sheen. Loose electric wires, open manholes and parking chaos are a common sight at Maurya Lok. Even protests inside the shopping complex have become a daily affair, leading to drastic fall in commercial activities.

Patna Municipal Corporation (PMC), which has its headquarters in one of the towers inside Maurya Lok, was supposed to revamp this market complex by August last year. Even urban development and housing department minister Suresh Kumar Sharma had earlier assured to renovate the market complex by August 15, 2019. However, nothing has been done so far.

The western side of this shopping complex is still lying excavated. The southern part has piles of PMC’s office waste, hindering connectivity and parking. Open manholes and dirty toilets are also a common sight. Even the park which has Swami Vivekanand’s statue has been left dug with trash on statue’s podium.

Ashraf Hasan, once a regular visitor to this place, said he stopped visiting the complex now. “It has become impossible to enter Maurya Lok in a four-wheeler. Even if one enters, there is no place to park the vehicle as the roads are dug and other portion has waste in the field,” Hasan added,

Kadamkuan resident Anita Prasad (40), who was found shopping at Maurya Lok the other day, said, “I have been buying clothes from here since my college days. The condition of Maurya Lok is deteriorating with each passing day.”

Shopkeepers blamed PMC for the poor condition of Maurya Lok. “It was much better before PMC’s office was shifted here. They have made the entire market a garbage dump. It has virtually turned into a dharna site. We have written to PMC officials and also met UDHD minister in this regard,” said Maurya Lok Shopkeeper Kalyan Samiti president Rajesh Kumar Dabloo.

One Ashwani Logan, who owns a shoe shop at Maurya Lok, said, “Whenever, anyone has problem with PMC, they hold dharna here. The place becomes so congested that buyers cannot come here. Our sales dropped by 90% when sanitation workers staged protests at this shopping complex in support of their demands. We were not even able to meet the establishment cost.”

Patna mayor Sita Sahu said funds crunch led to delay in renovation of Maurya Lok . “UDHD had promised Rs 10 crore for its renovation. However, we have not got the amount yet,” she added.

Title: Corona scare: Goa hotel sends back Chinese despite booking
Content: PANAJI: A starred hotel in South Goa recently asked a Chinese national who had a booking with it to leave. The man — who arrived in Goa by a Maharashtra-registered vehicle, came to India from the UK, and hasn’t been to China in over two months — then left the state.The Travel and Tourism Association of Goa (TTAG) said the hotel informed the health authorities about the Chinese guest on Wednesday. It couldn’t be confirmed if the man stayed in any other hotel.The TTAG, however, didn’t approve of the guest being asked to leave on account of his nationality. TTAG said health authorities ought to have been prompter in visiting the hotel as soon as they were informed.“They need not have waited till the next day to visit the hotel and check on the guest,” TTAG president Savio Messias told TOI. “As per my information, nobody visited the hotel till Thursday afternoon.”State epidemiologist Dr Utkarsh Betodkar said a health official from Chinchinim primary health centre — under whose jurisdiction the hotel falls — visited the hotel. “But he (the Chinese guest) had already left the hotel. He could not be contacted,” Betodkar said.Betodkar also said he has been interacting with hotel personnel during the past several days to create awareness about coronavirus . He said that targeted programmes were held for hotels.

Title: 5 injured as speeding bus hits school van in Koh-e-Fiza
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Bhopal: A speeding bus rammed into a school van carrying students of Campion School in Khajuri on Saturday morning. Four girls and a man were seriously injured in the accident. One girl’s index finger was severed in the incident and was re-attached after a surgery. The mishap led to a pile-up with several vehicles getting hit while the errant bus driver fled the scene. He was later arrested.

The incident occurred while the van had stopped on the Koh-e-Fiza main road to pick up children in the morning. The collision was so intense that the van hit the divider of the service lane. The van also hit a car parked in front, which in turn rammed into another car ahead. A man, who was getting off his car, was hit by the school van. He too fell on the road around five feet away.

There were around a dozen minor children on board the van, mostly girls. About four of them fell on the road and were seriously injured. The 9-year-old girl, whose index finger was severed from her hand, was operated at a hospital in Rohit Nagar, where the doctors have attached the finger back in a four-hour-long microsurgery. Apart from her, two minor sisters were undergoing treatment at a hospital near Royal Market.

The bus involved in the accident was supposed to go Guna from Halalpur bus stand and the errant driver was going to pick up passengers when he rammed into school van. He fled the spot after the incident. Koh-e-Fiza police reached the spot on getting information and rushed the injured students to hospital. Police seized the bus and arrested the errant driver after registering a case against him.

SHO, Koh-e-Fiza, Sudhir Arjaria, said that school van driver, GC Lal Yadav, 35, a resident of Bairagarh Kalan in Khajuri, told police that after picking up students from Koh-e-Fiza, he was going to drop them to school. Around 7.20am, he stopped in front of a gym on Koh-e-Fiza main road to pick up the children. At the same time, a speeding bus belonging to Qureshi Bus Service came from the back and rammed into the van. The van turned sidewise and stopped after hitting a divider and a car parked in front. About five minor girls fell on the road and sustained injuries. The students inside the van too sustained injuries.

SHO Arjaria said that four girls, including Arna Rathore, 9, Bilkis, 13, and her sister Amana, 9, and Ayesha, 13, were injured in the accident and rushed to hospital. All the injured girls are residents of Koh-e-Fiza. Arna is a student of class 2, while Ayesha and Bilkis are students of class 7. Amana is a student of class 3.

The SHO said that Arna’s index finger on the left hand was severed from her hand and she was operated at a hospital in Rohit Nagar. Bilkis sustained injuries on head and face while her younger sister, Amana, also sustained a head injury. They were admitted to a hospital near Royal Market. Ayesha had injured her legs and was discharged after treatment.

SHO Arjaria said that Arna’s father Mahendra is a businessman and supplies stationery while the father of Bilkis and Amana, Mohammed Akbar, takes catering contracts. Police have registered a case against errant bus driver Shafiq Khan and arrested him.

Eyewitness account

Advocate Vaibhav Choudhary, a resident of Jain Nagar near Lalghati, whose car was hit by the van, told TOI that he had gone to purchase grocery from a departmental store along with his friend Aslam Khan. He stopped the car in front of the store and was sitting on the driver’s seat while Aslam was getting down when the incident took place. Aslam fell almost five feet away on the road and sustained minor injuries. He was saved as he was wearing seat belt. When he saw the school girls of the van bleeding, Choudhary got down and asked the van driver to call their parents. The errant bus driver had fled the spot immediately after accident. Police reached the spot and rushed the students to hospital.

Box-

Too many cars parked near mishap spot

Arna’s father Mahendra Rathore told TOI that the main cause of accident is that a large number of vehicles are parked in front of the gym, at the accident spot, both in the morning and evening hours. Half of the road is occupied by the BRTS corridor and the vehicles are parked outside the service lane, which makes the area accident-prone. He said Arna’s finger was attached back by doctors in a four-hour long microsurgery and the family hopes for her speedy recovery.

Title: BJP may field Udayanraje for RS
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

CLEARED SKHER

Kolhapur: Three months after his defeat in Satara Lok Sabha by-election, BJP leadership is seriously thinking of fielding Udayanraje Bhosale , 13th descendant of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, for Rajya Sabha election from Maharashtra.

Top sources in BJP confirmed with TOI that the senior leaders of the party have principally agreed to nominate Bhosale for the election to be held in April this year. Former chief minister Devendra Fadnavis was pressing for Bhosale’s candidature.

BJP leaders, who are involved in the decision-making, said Bhosale was promised that he would be accommodated in Rajya Sabha in case he lost the by-election. Bhosale was reluctant to join BJP because of fear that he may be defeated in NCP bastion of Satara. “His fear is a reality and it’s the party’s duty to keep its promise,” said a top BJP leader.

Even after his defeat in Satara Lok Sabha by-election, BJP leaders believe that Bhosale has the potential to challenge NCP’s dominance in western Maharashtra. BJP is looking for a formidable face in the region and the party believes that a member of the royal family may be useful in the regional politics.

Party also hopes to keep the dominant Maratha community in good humor as may of the leaders held BJP responsible for luring Bhosale for its political objectives. Bhosale has been keeping a low profile after his defeat.

Sources in BJP said that senior leader Eaknath Khadse and party spokesperson Shaina N C were other aspirants for Rajya Sabha. However, Fadnavis and state BJP president Chandrakant Patil are pushing for Bhosale.

BJP leaders are still upset with Khadse as he had not stopped his outrage against state leaders. Central party leadership feels that Khadse is trying to emerge as a rallying point of disgruntled elements in Maharashtra BJP unit.

BJP had nominated Amar Sable last time, whose term will expire soon. Sable, who hails from Pune, has been given the hint that his tenure would not be extended.

BJP sources said a primary meeting was held at the residence of union home minister Amit Shah on Friday night. Bhosale was present at the meeting along with Fadnavis and Patil. BJP can send two Rajya Sabha members considering its strength in Assembly. Ramdas Aathwale’s candidature is considered as certain, said BJP sources.

Title: Citizens, activists oppose water tax hike proposal
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Kolhapur: Activists and citizens have objected to the Kolhapur Municipal Corporation’s (KMC) proposal for increasing the water tax rates by 30%.

The civic administration had presented the wax tax hike proposal before the standing committee which has recently forwarded the same to the general body meeting in which the final decision will be taken.

Water tax superintendent Prashant Pandat said that the revenue losses of the department are mounting and the water tax rates have not been hiked in the last six years. He said that owing to the shortage of revenue collection, the salaries of staff are not being paid regularly.

Baba Indulkar, an activist from the association ‘Common Man’ from Rajarampuri, said, “We have learnt that taxes for 50% of the water supplied is already collected. The government offices have dues of over Rs 6 crore. While drafting the proposal of water tax hike , the officials deliberately refrained from mentioning their own failures pertaining to run the water supply system properly. At present, dues have mounted to Rs 24 crore and civic authorities have not prepared any plan to recover them. We have requested the mayor and deputy mayor to not allow the tax hike.”

Activists from the association also listed several issues related to the water supply system. They said that the water supply to most areas in the city does not take place properly and, at the same time, some areas receive water twice a day for about two-three hours. Such imbalance in supply should be addressed, said activists.

They also threatened to initiate an agitation if the proposal for water tax hike gets approval from the general body.

Responding to their concerns, mayor Nilofer Ajrekar said that she will initiate talks with the corporators and the officials to ensure that all the issues grappling the water supply system are addressed immediately. “Before the GBM, I will talk to all the stakeholders once again. We, too, are against the hike in water tax rates as it will cause burden to the citizens. However, we have to address the concerns of the water supply department as well,” said Ajrekar.

Title: Looter, cop injured in exchange of fire
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Varanasi: A wanted looter and a police constable suffered bullet injuries during exchange of fire between criminals and Badlapur police in Jaunpur district in the small hours of Saturday.

Jaunpur SP Ashok Kumar said that after a specific tip-off, Badlapur cops had carried out a night-long checking drive on highways. In the small hours, when police tried to stop two youths on a bike near Kaderepur village, one of them opened indiscriminate fire on the cops and tried to escape.

A constable, identified as Arvind Singh, suffered bullet injuries. In retaliation, Badlapur policemen fired at the duo.

The looter suffered injuries in his leg and fell from the running bike, while his accomplice managed to escape.

Both the injured were rushed to the district hospital, from where they were referred to Varanasi.

Kumar said, “The arrested looter was identified as Shamle Yadav of Badlapur. He had been involved in many loot cases including the one at a jewellery shop in Singramau area on December 12, last year.

A country-made revolver, live cartridges and Rs 1200 cash were recovered from his possession.

Title: NWR unions to stir against pvt train plan
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Jaipur: Various employees unions of North Western Railway are planning to protest against the idea of allowing private players to operate trains on busiest circuits across the country. The unions said that railways has been the cheapest medium of transportation, while the move by the rail minister to give a nod to operate 150 private trains will hit its earnings.

Finance minister Nirmala Sitaraman in her budget speech had announced that railways will allow private players to run their trains on 100 routes across the country.

Railways employees unions of NWR are organising various meetings to take a final decision on if they should go for a strike against this initiative.

“This is first step towards privatization. Government will do all what they did to Air India. We will discuss on a strategy to show our anger and protest against the move. At any cost we will save railways to get privatized,” said Saurabh Dixit, divisional chairman of UPRMS told TOI.

Railways employees said allowing private players to use the infrastructure of railways will affect regular trains.

“Indian railways has been the cheapest mode of transportation for masses . These private players will merely run super luxury trains which won’t run on shorter distances. Also in trains run by Indian railways offer concessions in at least 65 categories of people including those awarded with Padma Shree, Bharat Ratna, differently abled, cancer patients, senior citizens and others. These operators will not only end these concessions but will also take a major chunk of revenue of railways,” said Vinod Mehta, general secretary, Uttar Pachim Railway Mazdooor Sangh.

Various unions including UPRMS and North Western Railways Employees Unions are having meetings to decide on if they can go for a strike on various anti-employee policies. “We will chalk out some result oriented strategy to combat the attempt of the Centre which is in a mood to facilitate the private players,” said general secretary of NWREU.TNN

Title: CRPF constable on the run after shooting at youth over petty dispute
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Bhopal: Three brothers, including a CRPF constable, along with their accomplices, allegedly attacked a 19-year-old youth over a petty dispute in front of his house in Govindpura on Friday evening. When they were assaulting the youth, his 22-year-old cousin brother tried to intervene. The accused CRPF constable then shot at him on the face with a pistol. The bullet pierced the victim’s cheek and got stuck in his upper neck.

The victim fell unconscious and was rushed him to AIIMS on a scooter in a critical condition. He was operated upon and the bullet was taken out of his neck. Govindpura police registered a case on charges of attempt to murder against the four accused, including three brothers and arrested three of them. The CRPF constable was still on the run and police were trying to find out whether the pistol he used to commit the crime was licensed or illegal.

SHO Govindpura Ashok Singh Parihar said that the complainant, Ritik Sahni, 19, a resident of Jayhind Nagar in Barkhera, told police that he takes flower decoration contracts. He said that a dispute took place between him and Farhan Khan over some issue on Thursday, during which he slapped Farhan. At that time, Farhan’s friend Ravi Wadekar, 19, a resident of Panchpeer Nagar in Barkheda, was accompanying him.

SHO Parihar said that Ritik told police that on Friday evening, around 5pm, he along with his friends Sandeep Nagar, Sheikh Asif and younger brother Rishabh Sahni, were chatting near Barkheda dispensary when Ravi and his accomplices, including friend Sandeep Soni, 24, reached the spot and started assaulting him over the dispute with Farhan.

Ritik told police that his younger brother Rishabh intervened and resolved the matter. They all returned to Jaihind Nagar and were standing in front of Ritik’s house when around 5.30pm, Ravi reached the spot with his elder brother Manoj Wadekar, 23, Sandeep Soni and others and started assaulting Ritik. Ritik’s cousin brother Rakesh Sahni, 22, came out to save him. Ravi called his eldest brother Raju Wadekar, 27, who is posted as constable in CRPF at Telangana and had come to Bhopal on vacation. Raju reached the spot and fired a shot on Rakesh before fleeing the spot.

Govindpura police registered an attempt to murder case against the accused brothers Ravi, Raju, Manoj and friend Sandeep. Ravi, Manoj and Sandeep were arrested while Raju was on the run.

Title: Rating auto drivers is just a click away
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Mayor K Sreekumar will inaugurate ‘ Hey Auto ’, a project for commuters to rate their ride and improve the service of auto drivers in the city, at 12 noon on Wednesday.

Using this scheme, the commuters can rate the auto drivers based on points. A mobile app and an interactive webpage have been readied for the project. Each auto driver will be given an unique ID card, and QR code and barcode can be read from that card.

The auto drivers with city permit will be enrolled in the scheme. The registration will begin at 12 noon on Wednesday. The ID cards issued to auto drivers will be displayed in a visible manner in autorickshaws. Commuters can also register complaints using this scheme. The corporation will tie up with city traffic police to follow up on complaints.

The auto drivers with city permits can turn up at the corporation office on Wednesday with driving licence, copy of licence and copy of permit card.

The mayor said the project aims at ensuring hassle-free ride for commuters, and at the same time, arrange a platform for commuters to communicate their experience to the city corporation.

The corporation will also award auto drivers who gain best ratings under the scheme. Sreekumar added that with the implementation of the scheme, the corporation aims to convert Thiruvananthapuram into an auto-friendly city.

Title: Bagilge: A village that hosts Shiva temple built in Hemadpanti architectural style
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Bagilge, a remote village on the border of Maharashtra-Karnataka in the Chandgad taluka hosts an ancient Shiva temple carved in black stone and built in Hemadpanti architectural style. The temple is beautiful even if it has been left in ruins. The temple needs to be restored in order to maintain the sanctity and beauty of the temple. The site is certainly worth studying for the architecture and temple researchers.

How to reach

Bagilge village, with around 250 houses, is located in Kolhapur district near Belgavi city. It is 115 km from Kolhapur city. From there, it takes two hours to reach the place.
