There is no other means of transport, unless a family member drops you by car or two-wheeler.” Poonam Mehan (45), a homemaker, whose daughter works in Gurgaon, said she spends Rs 200 to commute between New Ashok Nagar or Mayur Vihar Extension metro stations and her house every day.

Madhusudan Rai (55), a businessman, said he picks and drops his daughter, Jyoti, who studies in Dwarka, from the nearest metro station no matter how busy his schedule is. “The areas around Trilokpuri-Sanjay Lake metro station are not safe even for men as mugging is not uncommon in the area,” he added.

Mayur Vihar Phase-III, which came up in the 1990s, is surrounded by six Blue Line and one Pink Line metro stations, but all of them are 5-6 kilometres away. In the absence of an affordable and safe mode of last-mile connectivity, residents are completely dependent on personal vehicles.

The residents of the area have been demanding better metro connectivity for years, but to no avail. Vinod Nair, convener of United Forum of Residents from Mayur Vihar Phase-III, Vasundhara Enclave and Noida, said, “If the Magenta Line is extended from Botanical Garden to Anand Vihar, which is an interchange for Blue and Pink lines, it will benefit more than five lakh residents of not only Mayur Vihar Phase-III, but also Vasundhara Enclave and Khoda.”

“It will be a boon for residents if a Metrolite corridor comes to the area. There were plans to start a monorail service many years ago and feasibility studies for light rail were also carried out in 2014. It doesn’t matter which political party is in power, no one has been able to bring metro connectivity to Mayur Vihar Phase-III,” Nair said.

In January, responding to the pleas of the forum to either extend Magenta Line or plan Metrolite, DMRC had replied that the suggested corridors fall mostly in Uttar Pradesh and the residents could take up the proposal with the Uttar Pradesh government.

The residents’ forum has planned a peaceful rally on February 16 from Pocket B-6 in Mayur Vihar Phase-III to Ramlila Ground in Vasundhara Enclave to protest against the apathy of the government and demand a metro station, extension of Barapullah till Ghazipur and better roads. “We expect over 3,000 residents to take part in the rally,” Nair said.

Title: Kolkata: Four arrested with Rs 1.5 crore Yaba drugs
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Representative image

KOLKATA: In the third major synthetic Yaba drugs haul this year, the special task force of Kolkata Police has arrested four people—three of them Manipur-based drug dealers and one their Bengal counterpart—and recovered the contraband worth about Rs 1.5 crore.

“We caught the accused on Prince Golam Mohammad Shah Road close to Golf Club on Friday. They have been identified as Md Aksar Khan alias Asghar (27), Md Anish (32) and Md Abdul Majid (42) from Thoubal in Manipur and Mahasin Biswas (26) from Gobra in North 24 Parganas,” said DCP Aparajita Rai. Narcotics and psychotropic substances, consisting of amphetamines, were recovered. Cops seized 50,000 tablets, weighing 5.5kg. “The drugs were to be smuggled to Bangladesh via North 24 Parganas,” said Rai.

Title: Andhra Pradesh: Former Ranji player held for Rs 3.3 lakh con
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: A former Andhra Pradesh Ranji player, who conned a CMD of a private company by impersonatingthe personal assistant (PA) of MAUD minister KT Rama Rao, was arrested by Central Crime Station sleuths on Saturday.

Joint Commissioner of Police (CCS) Avinash Mohanty said that the accused, Budumuru Nagaraju, introduced himself as Tirupati, a PA to KTR, when he contacted the CMD of a company.

The accused requested the victim sponsor one Budumuru Nagaraju, a cricket player from Andhra Pradesh and claimed that he had been selected for the U-25 World Cup in England besides being selected for a franchise in IPL.

The accused connned the victim by making him believe that if his company sponsored Nagaraju, their company’s logo will be printed on the kit used by the player and it will be handed over to Nagaraju by KTR himself.

Believing it to be true, the victim transferred Rs 3.30 lakh to the bank account of the accused.

Later, the victim realised that he had been conned as there was no response from the accused and lodged a complaint.

The accused was arrested based on his phone records and bank account details.

During the investigation, police discovered that he is a repeat offender and has been arrested previously for conning different victims.

Last year, Nagaraju was accused of impersonating BCCI chief selector, MSK Prasad and had been arrested by Andhra Pradesh police.

Title: Jind man offers birth certificates for Rs 2,500, booked
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Representative image

JIND: Even as many in India are vociferously declaring ‘Hum Kagaz Nahi Dikhayenge’, some enterprising man in Jind has gone to town with his offer: birth certificates for Rs 2,500. The posters that are found all over Jind have created quite a buzz here and security agencies have lodged a complaint with the police regarding the same. Following this, Jind police have booked an unknown miscreant for cheating.

Station house officer of Jind city police station Surender Singh said, “The accused obviously is seeking to cash in on the panic over National Register of Citizenship. We are investigating the matter. No arrests so far.”

“Deputy civil surgeon, Jind hospital, Pale Ram Kataria, said the matter had come to the notice of health department as well. “I even called the number given in the poster and was told that I should go to Delhi to get the certificate. This is illegal. According to rule, one can get birth certificates free of cost within 21 days of birth. Between 21 and 28 days, registrars, such as primary health doctors, can issue the certificate. District registrar (civil surgeon) is authorised to issue for a year and after that deputy commissioner is the final authority who can issue birth certificates after a through investigation by revenue officers. This will cost Rs 50,” he added.

The legally issued birth certificates will need nine to 10 documents, including ration card, school record and hospital record of birth, deputy civil surgeon said.

Title: Work of Chhoti Chaupar on hold, Badi Chaupar to remain square in shape
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Jaipur: Protest against the changing of the shape of iconic Chhoti Chaupar is showing results as its work has been put on hold. Further, authorities have decided not to interfere with the shape of Badi Chaupar, which is now being constructed in its original square shape.

The historical Chaupars of the Walled City were originally in square shape, but with the work of Metro , authorities constructed the outer portion of the Chhoti Chaupar in round shape. This was considered to be tampering with the heritage structure of the city and activists including the Walled City residents protested against it. Department has now decided to put the work on hold and is constructing Badi Chaupar in square shape.

An official of Jaipur Metro Rail Corporation on condition of anonymity said, “The original shape of Chhoti Chaupar is still square, it is just the outer boundary which was constructed in a round shape for traffic purpose. We had taken recommendations from traffic police as well before constructing it. However, public is sentimental regarding the issue so we have decided to put it on hold and have sent it to the heritage committee for inspection. Any change in the shape of Chhoti Chaupar will be done after the decision of the technical committee. Meanwhile, Badi Chaupar is being constructed in a square shape. But we can assume that the square shape will be a traffic hurdle for the commuters in such a busy market area.”

The Walled City was listed as a UNESCO heritage site in 2019 with the commitment to preserve its cultural and architectural heritage. Any change in the shape of any of its structures from a square to a circle in the presence of Heritage Technical Committee questions the seriousness of the state in sticking to its commitments.

Title: New mechanism for bldg permissions from Apr 2
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Hyderabad: In a month-and-a-half from now, Telangana will have a new mechanism to clear buildings and the way they are built. In a far-reaching move, the state government is planning to do away with permission for construction of buildings up to 75 square yards. Registration and ownership documents will be enough if one wants to construct a house in 75 sq yards.

Known as Telangana State Building Permission Approval And Self-Certification System ( TS-BPASS ), which will be rolled out on April 2, the government, under the new system, is also going to grant permissions to non-highrise structures (in about 600 sq yards). Online submission with relevant documents will be more than enough.

In case of more than 600 sq yards, the applicant will receive the permission through the single-window system. The town planning authorities will have to clear it within 21 days, failing which the plan is deemed to have been approved. Apart from penal action against officials, the government will have powers to dismiss staffers, under TS-BPASS, if they resort to corrupt means.

Also, under the new system, if any applicant or a building owner is found to have deviated from the plan, the structure will be demolished without any notice.

Municipal administration minister KT Rama Rao said TS-BPASS is being unveiled, on the lines of TSiPASS, to ensure a hassle-free building permission process for people. He asked officials to create an awareness on TS-BPASS among people by conducting sessions with residential welfare associations and ward committees.

“The government is working towards offering better services to the people. Decentralisation and formation of new districts, mandals and municipalities was one of the biggest achievements of the government after Telangana was formed,” KTR said while addressing district collectors and additional collectors. An orientation programme was conducted with the collectors and additional collectors on the proposed Municipal Act and Pattana Pragathi at MCRHRD Institute here on Friday.

KTR said he did not expect that Sircilla would become a district headquarters. “I can proudly say that no other state has brought in so many administrative reforms in the country in such a short span.” An effective implementation of the new Municipal Act would transform cities and towns in Telangana, he said.

The minister said that there would be challenges in the implementation of the Municipal Act initially. He said Pattana Pragathi would be launched soon on the lines of Palle Pragathi. “The best practices from some of the urban local bodies can be emulated and implemented across the state. Telangana’s towns should set a benchmark for the rest of the country,” KTR said.

Title: CBI court allows Jagan’s plea
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Hyderabad: The CBI court in Hyderabad on Friday allowed the plea of AP CM Jaganmohan Reddy seeking exemption from court appearances. He filed a plea through his advocate G Ashok Reddy seeking exemption on two grounds. One, he had an appointment with Union home minister Amit Shah and second, he was busy with the budget discussion.

The court was also briefed by Ashok Reddy and the CBI counsel on the high court’s decision to hear Jagan ’s plea in April on allowing his advocate represent him at the trial court.

The CBI court allowed his plea for this week’s hearing and posted the case to February 28. TNN

Title: Bull dragged behind a tractor, one arrested
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Jaipur: A case has been registered against a man for tying a bull behind a tractor and dragging it for nearly 5 km in Bassi police station area on Friday.

While the accused fled the spot initially, police detained others who were present at the time of incident. By late evening the accused was also arrested from his village in Bassi. The cattle was taken to Hingoniya cow shelter where it is undergoing treatment. The video of the incident was also circulated on social media.

The accused was identified as Shola Ram who is said to be in his late 20s. The video showed that one leg of the bull was tied to the back of the tractor and it was lying on the ground while the accused drove the vehicle.

Bassi SHO Shiv Kumar Bhardwaj said, “A person registered a case against the accused and showed us the video. It does not appear that the accused was suffering from any mental issues and did this cruel act in a fit of anger as he thought that the bull was destroying the crop in his field.”

Following the incident, the bull was taken to the shelter by a few animal lovers where it was treated. The animal was injected glucose after which it managed to stand up, though officials said that it was still in critical state and there are chances that it would not survive.

“The accused absconded from the spot as soon the case was registered but there were a few others whom we called to the police station. We questioned them and got the accused’s location following which our team went and arrested him. Even if the animal was destroying the crops, this was not the way to deal with the situation. The incident is extremely brutal and we worked swiftly to catch the accused,” added the official. A case under animal cruelty act has been registered.

Title: End term 1 before Nat’l Games: DoE to schools
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Panaji: The directorate of education (DoE) has instructed schools that for the upcoming 2020-21 academic year, the first term exam must end by October 10. This is in view of the 36th National Games the state will be hosting later this year, from October 20 to November 4. Schools have also been told not to schedule any internal examinations between January 1, 2021 and March 15, 2021, due to the Census 2021 exercise.

“As per directives of the ministry of home affairs, New Delhi, it is instructed not to have any school examination during the period of training and field operation of Census 2021, January 1 to March 15. This instruction is to be followed without fail,” schools have been told in a circular.

While declaring the academic schedule for the upcoming year, director of education Vandana Rao has inserted another new requirement for schools to meet.

“All heads of schools are to celebrate the occasions that are informed to them by directorate. All programs of the Government of India will continue to remain binding till the duration of the same. If any new event is to be incorporated in the schedule for the coming year, the same will be informed to the school from time to time,” Rao has said in the circular.

During the current academic year, teachers and even political parties have criticised the DoE, particularly Rao, for constantly issuing circulars, stating that Union government circulars are imposed on schools blindly.

Rao further came into conflict with teachers when she issued a show-cause notice to schools when institution heads failed to turn up for a meeting called for by the director to discuss implementation of various government of India programmes such as Fit India, Ek Bharat Shreshta Bharat, 150 years of Mahatma Gandhi’s birth anniversary etc.

Schools said the circular was issued at too short a notice.

Title: T, AP caught in tussle over funds given to local bodies
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Hyderabad: Even as the dust on the central funds to Telangana is yet to settle down with industry minister KT Rama Rao picking holes in Union finance minister Niramala Sitharaman’s claims, Telangana and Andhra Pradesh are embroiled in a tussle over funds released to local bodies to the tune of Rs 3,139 crore.

The dispute arose between the Telugu states after the Centre gave one instalment of funds to the successor state of AP in 2014. Though the dispute did not spiral out of control, Telangana has kept the pot boiling in the last six years in every meeting officials of both the states sat to iron out differences.

The instalment pertained to the second quarter of June. Till then, the undivided AP got the fund devolution as recommended by the 13th Finance Commission. Telangana said it was supposed to get Rs 3,139 crore. “Telangana’s contention is that the second instalment after the state was carved in 2014-15 had gone to AP. So, it argues that it needs to get 42% of the amount as per the Andhra Pradesh Reorganisation Act, 2014,” highly-placed sources told TOI.

AP, on the other hand, has been dodging the issue on the grounds that there are other contentious issues which need to be resolved first. Reportedly, Telangana paid some bills of purchased power from AP as it did not get its due share in the local bodies’ funds.

While funds issue remained unresolved when TDP government was at the helm, present AP chief secretary is believed to have asked finance officials to work out reconciliation formula with their counterparts in Telangana.

Telangana is also demanding release of Rs 1,428 crore to local bodies as recommended by the 14th Finance Commission for 2015-20.

Title: Assess shut parks so that they can be opened: Kolkata mayor
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Hakim issued the instruction after he received a call from a senior citizen, who complained the Kalighat park ... Read More

KOLKATA: Mayor Firhad Hakim on Saturday ordered to prepare a list of city’s parks that had remained out of bounds to citizens and assess the reasons behind keeping them shut so that measures could be taken to reopen them.

Hakim issued the instruction after he received a call from a senior citizen, who complained the Kalighat park had been shut for over two months. The caller, on the Talk-to-Mayor session, requested Hakim to look into the reasons for the “forced closure” and arrange for its reopening as soon as possible. The mayor told Debasish Chakraborty, director-general of the KMC parks department, to probe into the matter and take corrective measures at the earliest. The civic parks department looks after over 700 large and small parks located across 144 KMC wards.

According to a KMC parks official, this is not the first time that a complaint against closure of the Kalighat park had reached the civic headquarters. “Despite protests from residents, we had to take a sizeable area of the park for a water booster pumping station. It is really unfortunate that the rest of the park has been made out of bounds to residents, especially senior citizens,” he said.

KMC officials pointed out several other parks in the city had also been shut to locals. “We often receive complaints about park gates being locked for weeks together. We send our men and in most cases, the complaints turns out to be true,” said an official. A couple of months ago, civic commissioner Khalil Ahmed had told borough executive engineers to look after the health of the parks, borough-wise.

Areas, where the KMC needed to survey closed parks were Dum Dum, Chitpore, Arabindo Sarani, Rafi Ahmed Kidwai Road, Bhowanipore, Ballygunge, Behala, Kidderpore, Tollygunge, Jadavpur and areas off Bypass, a civic official said.

Title: Baga hotel case: 10-day cop custody for all 38 accused
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Representative image

CALANGUTE: The 38 persons who were arrested by Calangute police for criminal trespass, theft and molestation of female staff of a hotel-cum-casino at Baga were remanded in 10 days police custody when they were produced before Mapusa JMFC on Saturday.

The bail application of the main accused was rejected. Advocate Arun Bras de Sa, representing the operators of the hotel, while objecting to the bail application of the main accused, said the case needed to be investigated further.

The main accused, said to be the owner of the hotel, had stormed into the casino on the ground floor along with the other accused early Thursday morning, in an alleged attempt to take physical possession of the premises that he had leased to another company. The matter is in dispute.

The accused also allegedly stole Rs 2.5 crore in cash and a large amount in casino chips.

Title: Read the Constitution, BJP tells KTR
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Hyderabad: Telangana BJP on Friday asked TRS working president KTR to stop reading comics and read the Constitution.

BJP spokesperson K Krishna Sagar Rao said KTR seems to be forgetting that Telangana is a state in India and not a country in itself. “KTR’s statements in the last two days about central funds are quite deceptive and politically motivated. Article 268 to 293 part 12 of the Constitution outlines the tax revenue sharing provisions and KTR should read it,” he said.

Rao faulted KTR’s logic of expecting all tax collected by state as its own revenue. “His argument is fundamentally flawed and bereft of any understanding of the Centre-state financial relations and tax sharing provisions laid down by the Constitution.” he added. TNN

Title: At 145 AQI, city recorded poor air quality on Friday
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Hyderabad: The city witnessed poor air quality on Friday with the index used to measure pollutants registering above normal records. The Air Quality Index , measured by the Central Pollution Control Board, put the city’s value at 145.

A good range lies between 0-60. The 145 figure falls into the ‘moderate’ category wherein there could be breathing discomfort to people with lungs, asthma and heart diseases.

A similar measurement done by US Consulate’s air monitoring system showed a reading of 155 at 8.30pm. It indicated a peak of 272 earlier in the day. This falls in the ‘unhealthy’ category described as levels at which “everyone may begin to experience health effects; members of sensitive groups may experience more serious health effects.”

A source in Telangana State PCB said, “With cold weather conditions, pollution levels generally remain high because of inversion effect. The pollutants will not rise to upper layers of atmosphere leading to higher readings. Higher AQI levels would soon dip as temperatures soar.”

Title: Coronavirus in Delhi: 17 with coronavirus symptoms hospitalised
Content:
Picture used for representational purpose only

NEW DELHI: Delhi government has identified 17 local residents with history of travel to China who showed symptoms of coronavirus infection. They have been hospitalised.According to state health officials, till February 13, over 5,700 such passengers were approached after being informed by the Delhi airport authorities. “As many as 4,707 passengers were found asymptomatic and advised for home isolation (self-quarantined). Total 17 patients were found symptomatic and isolated at hospitals,” a senior official of the Delhi health department said.The number of passengers, who remain untraced, stands at 817, the official said, quoting the data collated by the health department.The number of passengers pending surveillance stands at 68, according to the data. Passengers arriving from China, Hong Kong, Thailand and Singapore are being screened for possible exposure to the respiratory virus at 21 identified airports in the country, including Delhi airport, from January 17.“Anyone, who gets flu-like symptoms should immediately contact the nearest control room,” the official said.The death toll in China’s novel coronavirus epidemic has climbed to 1,523 with 143 new fatalities reported mostly from the worst-affected Hubei province while the confirmed cases jumped to over 66,000, health officials said on Saturday. India has so far reported three confirmed cases of the virus, all in Kerala.One of the three medical students, who had tested positive for novel coronavirus infection and were treated at a hospital in Kerala, has been discharged after recovery, union health minister Harsh Vardhan had said on Thursday. About the other two, he said subsequent tests indicated significant reduction in “viral load”.The Centre had airlifted more than 600 persons, mostly students, from China in the aftermath of the outbreak of coronavirus infection about a fortnight ago. A total of 406 people of them are housed at a quarantine facility of the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP). Officials at the ITBP facility said all quarantined persons tested negative in the first round of tests. On Friday, final samples were taken to conduct repeat tests.“Based on the reports, a decision will be taken to discharge the travellers,” PRO of ITBP, Vivek Kumar Pandey, said in a statement.

Title: Only CM Pramod Sawant, four MLAs will garland Shivaji statue at Ponda
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Pramod Sawant

PONDA: This year, only five dignitaries will garland the statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj at the Farmagudi fortress during the state’s official Shiv Jayanti celebration on February 19. These are chief minister Pramod Sawant and MLAs of the four constituencies that make up Ponda taluka — Ramkrishna Dhavalikar (Marcaim), Ravi Naik (Ponda), Subhash Shirodkar (Shiroda) and Govind Gaude (Priol).

The rest of the dignitaries present at the function will offer flowers, but at the base of the statue.

This is the first time such a change is being made.

Priol MLA and art and culture minister Govind Gaude said that the change was mooted in a bid to reduce time spent on the garlanding ceremony and instead give more time for the performances put up by children.

A day-long celebration has been planned at the Farmagudi fortress to commemorate the 393rd birth anniversary of the Maratha king, Gaude said.

Title: Body of 8-year-old boy found in Chapora river
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Representative image

SALIGAO: The body of an eight-year-old boy, Sahil Salgaonkar, was found in the Chapora river below the Siolim-Chopdem bridge early Saturday morning.

Salgaonkar, a resident of Siolim , had been missing since Friday.

Anjuna police inspector Suraj Gawas said Salgaonkar was a child with special needs and had been suffering from epilepsy.

The missing complaint lodged by the boy’s father stated that Salgaonkar had gone to play with other children after returning home from school on Friday, but never returned.

Police suspect that he fell into the river while suffering an epileptic fit. They denied that it was a case of suicide.

Salgaonkar’s body was spotted in the river by locals of Bhatti-Oxel, who helped police fish it out. Gawas said the body was subsequently sent to the GMC, Bambolim, for an autopsy and that further investigation was under way.

Title: Delhi: Two children’s bodies found in Jahangirpuri drain in two days
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: Two children were found dead inside a drain in northwest Delhi’s Jahangirpuri in the past two days.

Police said in both the cases, the children appeared to have drowned , but a probe was under way to rule out any foul play. The bodies have been sent for autopsy, they added.

DCP (North West) Vijayanta Arya said an investigation was underway by a team from the Jahangirpuri police station.

Police said the first incident took place on Saturday, when the locals spotted the body of an eight-year-old boy floating in the drain. The child had been missing for the past one week. Police were informed and the body was fished out and sent for a postmortem.

An officer said the child’s mother lived at a shack near the drain and had lodged a missing complaint a few days ago. A search was already being conducted in the area to locate him. Prima facie the incident appears to be a case of drowning. Police are awaiting the autopsy report to establish the exact cause of death.

The second incident was reported on Friday night when a girl of the same age was found dead in the drain on the same stretch. The girl’s mother had alerted the neighbours, who had begun the hunt for the child. They later spotted the body being stuck in the sludge and alerted the cops, who then fished the body out.

A team has been formed to probe both the cases, while the cops are also checking if the cases were related.

Title: 13-year-old boy, who had jumped off school bldg, dies
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Hyderabad: A 13-year-old student, who had jumped off the third floor of his school in Balkampet area on January 29, died while undergoing treatment on Friday. He was class 8 student in a private school and resident of SR Nagar.

He jumped off the building allegedly after he was scolded by a teacher for misbehaving in the classroom.

Initially, police had booked a case against the school management under the Juvenile Justice Act and Section 338 (Causing grievous hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others) of the IPC, which was altered to Section 304-A (causing death by negligence) of the IPC on Friday. TNN

Title: Delhi public toilet survey: Civic bodies complain to ministry
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Of the 100 toilets visited by the agency in east Delhi, 76 were found to be unusable (File photo)

NEW DELHI: Two days after the ministry of housing and urban affairs (MoHUA) came out with ‘Delhi toilet survey 2019-20’ in which huge number of toilets were reported to be unusable and dirty in the city — specially in east Delhi — the civic bodies raised objections and took up the matter with the ministry.

East Delhi Municipal Corporation commissioner Dilraj Kaur claimed the survey was done in November and after that there was drastic improvement in the condition of toilets.

“We differ with the findings of the survey conducted by the agency empanelled with MoHUA in current circumstances. In January, we also got a survey done by CURE, another empanelled agency with the Centre and its results showed that 94% of the toilets were operational. On the basis of the result, we had applied for revalidating our ‘open defecation’ certificate and was granted the same after third party survey,” said Kaur.

“In these circumstances, how could we believe that our toilets were unusable or remained dirty. Despite running short of funds and resources, we have been putting best efforts to construct and maintain public conveniences,” Kaur said, adding that they had raised the matter at the right platform wherein their points were acknowledged.

As per the ministry’s survey report, of the 1,175 toilet units in the capital, 36% were found “unusable” while just 12.5% got the “excellent” tag. Of the five municipalities, EDMC scored less than 22% on factors like usable taps with no leakage, clean and polished mirrors, litter bins and availability of hand-wash soaps.

Of the 100 toilets visited by the agency in east Delhi, 76 were found to be unusable, 18 usable but dirty, five clean and one very clean. The agency had also found two toilets dirty, five unusable and 25 clean in New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) area.

Unsatisfied with the findings, NDMC officials had asked for details. “Though we differed with the report, we asked for the details of toilets surveyed by the agency. The idea is to know the reason and improve their condition before the final round of Swachh Survekshan to be conducted in March. Ideally these details should have been provided by now because not enough time is left,” said an NDMC official.

The civic agency said it had given directions to officials in engineering and electrical departments to visit each and every toilet complex in the area, fix the loopholes and make provision for other facilities. “We have also ensured that all toilets were located on GPS locator,” said the official.

The council has over 330 toilets. Of them, 290 were outsourced, six were maintained by Sulabh International and 37 by NDMC (mostly located in clusters or back lanes). Of them, the department claimed to have provided advance facilities at 84 toilets. These smart toilets meet the parameters of ODF++ category under Swachh Bharat Mission.

Title: Passenger held with one kg gold at Hyd airport
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Hyderabad: Customs officials at RGI Airport seized one kilogram gold from a passenger on Saturday. The passenger, identified as Senthil Kumar, is a resident of Pudukkottai in Tamil Nadu. He was found moving suspiciously by a CISF Intelligence constable, following which two officials checked him and found four packets of gold paste.

According to officials, he arrived to the city from Singapore in Scoot Airlines. During checking, officials recovered 400 grams of gold paste in two packets from his socks and 700 grams of gold paste in two packets from his underwear. Kumar and the seized gold was handed over to AIU-Customs of the airport for further necessary action. TNN

Title: ‘Restrictions meant to curb protests’
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Calangute: Tourists visiting the state and moving around in large groups have nothing to worry about section 144 of CrPC being invoked for 60 days, according to ports minister Michael Lobo .

He told reporters on Saturday that although section 144 prohibits gatherings of four or more people, it will not affect tourism in any way.

Lobo said the restrictions have been imposed to prevent people from holding meetings wherein issues that polarise communities or create controversies are being raised. He was referring to meetings held to either denounce or back CAA and NRC.

“There will be no problem for tourism,” he said referring to fears that tourists may stop coming to Goa as they might not be allowed to gather at one spot or travel in groups. “The government has already made this clear to the tourism industry and the message has been spread through social media that visitors have nothing to worry about,” he said.

Title: CCP to give discounted monthly passes
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Panaji: Pay-parking begun in Panaji from Saturday on all the notified roads. Two- and four-wheelers will be charged a parking fee on nine stretches in the state capital.

Monthly parking passes will be given out to motorists at a discounted rate. The entire system has also been digitised. Parking attendants will check the vehicle number on the pass, scan it and issue electronically generated receipts.

“If someone has two vehicles, they must apply for a pass for both the vehicles,” said mayor Uday Madkaikar.

He said that the implementation of parking fee is not a move to harass locals, but an attempt to discourage double parking and haphazard parking. “This move will instill discipline in such parking practices. Gradually, we shall move to other streets in Panaji as well,” he said.

The Corporation of the City of Panaji (CCP) has instructed the contractor to train parking attendants to discourage double-parking, driving on footpaths, etc.

“There are hundreds of vehicles that enter the city on a daily basis. They can park their car at the multi-storey pay-parking at Patto and use other means to access the city,” he said.

He also said that the roads will be painted with ‘pay-parking’ demarcation after hotmixing. “Following the Carnival, we will start the work. We are going to hotmix nine roads by May,” he said.

Government vehicles are to be exempted from paying this fee, but CCP will make it compulsory for them after amending the notification.

“I appeal to people to cooperate and comply with the parking fee. Anyone that refuses will have to go through the course of law. This is not illegal cash collection; we are carrying this out within the framework of law,” he said.

Title: Pulwama attack anniv: Tributes paid to 40 CRPF martyrs in Hyd
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Hyderabad: Glowing tributes were paid to 40 CRPF martyrs on first anniversary of Pulwama terror attack at an event at Southern Sector, CRPF, on Friday.

Twenty eight family members of CRPF martyrs from Telangana and AP were honoured. “I thought my son Narasimha will return home. But, his torn uniform reached home,” Lingaiah, father of jawan Narasimha, recalled. “Narasimha joined CRPF in 2005. He worked in sensitive areas in Jammu & Kashmir. He was killed in an encounter with Naxals in Chhattisgarh in 2014,” Lingaiah of Siddipet said.

Minister KTR said in a tweet: “We will not forget, we will not forgive!” TNN

Title: Peacock found dead near KBR park
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Hyderabad: A peacock was found dead on the road near KBR Park on Friday. A passer-by, who found the dead bird informed the police on Dial 100, following which a mobile patrol vehicle staff of Banjara Hills police reached the spot.

Though officials initially thought that the bird could have died after being hit by a vehicle, they found no external injuries on the body. Forest officials said the peacock died due to cardiac arrest. Hyderabad divisional forest officer Poojari Venkateshwarulu said, “Post-mortem reports indicate that the bird died of cardiac arrest and blood clots were noticed in the heart.” TNN

Title: Defamation case against TOI, Tamil daily quashed
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

CHENNAI: In a direct blow to the state machinery for attempting to curtail media freedom through criminal defamation complaints, the Madras high court has asserted that such attempts are a direct invasion of the right to freedom of expression and speech guaranteed under the Constitution.

Justice M Dhandapani , quashing two criminal defamation complaints registered against the Times of India and a Tamil daily, said, “While it is the duty of the court to safeguard the interests of those persons holding public office from being defamed for discharging their public functions, equally, citizens should also be safeguarded from the governmental machinery against malicious prosecution.”

The entire democratic polity achieves a high only when there is an uncompromising print/visual media which takes to the citizens of the country the happenings around them, he said. “Derailing the print media from publishing content, which in no way can be termed defamatory, by initiating prosecution, is nothing but an attack on the rights enshrined under the Constitution,” the judge added.

The criminal complaints against TOI and the Tamil daily “Dina Malar” were filed in 2014 by the AIADMK government led by the then chief minister, J Jayalalithaa , for publishing an interview of BJP member Subramanian Swamy .

Alleging that the newspapers were guilty of criminal defamation by publishing derogatory statements made by Swamy in the interview, the government lodged the complaint. Aggrieved, the newspapers moved the high court.

Allowing the pleas, the judge held that the government’s action against the petitioners for carrying the interview was a direct invasion of the right of freedom of speech and expression that cannot be curtailed by invocation of Section 499 (criminal defamation) of the IPC.

In the present case, the court said, the print media, having merely reported the interview of Swamy without adding anything to it, which is even evident from the government orders, cannot be said to have published material that has harmed the reputation of the office of the chief minister in respect of her conduct in the discharge of her public functions.

“Before parting with the case, one other important fact which has attracted the attention of this court also needs to be noted here. The government orders sanctioning prosecution against media houses were issued within a span of 24 hours of the news articles being published. This court, even at the outset, is not imputing any malice in the action of the prosecution. However, the speed with which such prosecution has been initiated is an issue which passes through the mind of this court,” Justice Dhandapani said.

Title: 3 puppies burnt to death in Yapral
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Hyderabad: Three puppies were burnt to death by unidentified persons in an open plot in Surya Nagar colony at Yapral on Saturday.

Two puppies survived the fire, were given treatment by a community animal protector and are being taken care of by the locals.

The incident came to light when a schoolteacher, who was passing by, noticed the pups burning in the fire and ran to help them, following which a few other locals came to help. The locals alerted an animal rights group, who sent a community animal protector to the spot.

“The mother dog was howling and did not even let anyone touch the pups even after they were dead,” said Arun Ganeshan, a resident of Surya Nagar colony. Photos and videos of the incident were shared on social media, triggering outrage among animal lovers.

“Some workers apparently wanted to clear the bushes in the area by burning them down. When we questioned them, they said that they did not notice the dogs,” said Lakshmi, a resident.

Title: One week hence, Disha app sees over a lakh downloads, even outside Andhra Pradesh
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Representative image

VIJAYAWADA: More than one lakh people have downloaded the Disha mobile application since its launch a week back. And the Disha control room has received thousands of calls from curious women testing the app.

The app, developed by Andhra Pradesh police , is part of a slew of measures initiated by the state government to step up women safety. Among these while the Disha legislation is yet to receive President’s assent to come into force, the app has not only elicited enthusiastic response but also led to people witness immediate police action against perpetrators of crimes against women.

The first case was registered after an excise official, who used the app after she was harassed by three unknown persons on a bus. After receiving the distress call, cops intercepted the bus near Eluru within ten minutes and apprehended the harassers. Police then issued a zero FIR and later transferred the case to the police station concerned.

In another incident, which was also reported at Eluru, a women used the ‘shake trigger’ feature after her brother-in-law molested her when her husband was away. The Disha control room received a video and audio footage of the victim on the app. The cops rushed to her rescue in less than six minutes and arrested her brother-in-law. Similarly, police came to the rescue of a girl, who complained about an unidentified person abusing her on phone, another girl being eve-teased regularly.

Advanced features such as shake trigger, track my travel, information about nearest safe places and police stations have struck a chord with women across the states, said director general of police (DGP) D Gautam Sawang. In fact, the app was also downloaded by people from United States of America (USA), Australia, UAE, Kuwait and other countries.

Speaking to TOI, Sawang said people from other countries are also downloading the app to take a look at its advanced features. However, the app will not work outside Andhra Pradesh as it is designed in such a way that the area is geo fenced and the SOS calls will initiate only when the mobile is within the boundaries of Andhra Pradesh, he said.

Cops are now working on improving the response time, which is 10 minutes on an average. “We have been analysing all the calls received so far and trying to reduce the response time by identifying the practical difficulties in deployment” he said.

Title: Bhim Army chief warns of more Shaheen Baghs
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Jaisalmer: Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad has said the Centre was violating the rights of Dalits, minorities and tribals and warned that 5,000 Shaheen Baghs woukld come up in the country in the controversial CAA was not revoked.

He added an all-India bandh has been called on February 23 in protest against CAA. He said people in power want to break the country in the name of religion.

He said if the Constitution was not protected, many Shaheen Baghs would come up in the country. He made the comments at a huge rally organised by Bhim Army and Muslim Mahasabha at BR Ambedkar Circle at Pokaran on Friday against CAA, NRC and NPR.

Large number of people from Muslim and Dalit communities from Pokaran assembly constituency attended the rally. He said Shaheen Bagh had disturbed the government and if this law was not revoked, then 5,000 Shaheen Bagh will come up across the country.

He said that if this law is implemented, people will be asked for proof of being an Indian.

He said the dream of people breaking the country will never get fulfilled. “It is our right to protect our rights. The govt is violating the rights of Dalits and minorities and will not allow to happen,” he said.

He appealed to people make the bandh on February 23 a success.

Taking dig at PM Narendra Modi, he said he did not have any issue to win elections and was trying to bring this law to polarise votes as Ram Mandir issue had been settled.

He added that people of Delhi gave BJP a serious setback.

“Women are on dharna at Shaheen Bagh for more than a month but the BJP government at the Centre was not repealing the Act,” he added.

Box

Alwar: Bhimrao Ambedkar’s son Prakashrao held a protest in Alwar on Saturday againt CAA and NRC where he said that the government this initiative is against the Constitution. He said that anyone born in India is citizen of the country and the government has no right to question it. He further added that if the government does not take back the acts then it will be the cause of unrest and disharmony in the country. He also said that the country got independence 70 years back so there is no requirement for NRC and there is some other intention behind the government implementing NRC and if the decision is not revoked then situation will become very bad in the country.

Title: Arvind Kejriwal CM: Arvind Kejriwal charts map for third stint as Delhi CM
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Delhi CM-designate Arvind Kejriwal with his cabinet ministers during a dinner meeting

NEW DELHI: Determined to hit the ground after taking oath as chief minister , AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday discussed the roadmap for Delhi’s development with the six AAP MLAs who will be sworn in as cabinet ministers on Sunday.

The minister designates — Manish Sisodia, deputy CM in the previous government, and ministers Gopal Rai, Satyendar Jain, Kailash Gahlot, Rajendra Pal Gautam and Imran Hussain — joined the discussion followed by dinner at the chief minister’s residence on Saturday evening.

AAP has decided to repeat all the ministers because it believes that people voted it back to power because of the work done by the government and for continuing the work. “Hosted my Delhi cabinet-designate colleagues for dinner at my residence. Congratulated them on their victory in the election and wished them success for their term as ministers in Delhi govt,” Kejriwal tweeted.

The discussions revolved around boosting public transport, expanding the network of mohalla clinics, further improvement in education infrastructure and quality of education, cleaning of Yamuna, sanitation, fighting pollution, providing 24-hour water supply, etc.

“Kejriwal and the minister designates discussed initiatives on which action needs to be taken on priority in the next three months. The government’s focus will be on developing a roadmap for making Delhi a 21st century global city,” said AAP sources.

Priority will be given to bringing in more buses to boost the city’s public transport system. At least 1,300 electric buses, besides 3,000 CNG buses — 1,000 for DTC and 2,000 for cluster scheme — are expected to be procured in six months. A total of 1,000 cluster buses will be air-conditioned.

The previous AAP government had approved 4,300 new buses, some of which were brought in phases. Among these were 529 standard-floor buses with hydraulic lifts added to the cluster scheme fleet since August 2019.

Mohalla clinics, the basic healthcare facility for citizens, have been one of the most talked about projects of the AAP government. In the last five years, the government opened 451 mohalla clinics and seeks to open another 351 by April.

AAP has promised to reduce pollution by one-third. It will earmark funds for sanitation and other purposes so that the municipal corporations cannot divert the funds. The party believes that the pace of development will be very fast now as compared to the previous term, when a tussle with the Centre allegedly created obstructions in the functioning of Delhi government .

“Kejriwal asked all minister designates to work passionately on every point of AAP’s guarantee card immediately after taking oath,” Manish Sisodia said after the meeting. The guarantee card includes 10 points about education, health, women’s safety, etc.

Title: Delhi: Gargi College students continue protest, say all demands not met yet
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

It was the sixth day of protest on Saturday after students were harassed (File photo)

NEW DELHI: Students of Delhi University’s Gargi College are continuing their protest, stating that their demands have not been met. It was the sixth day of protest on Saturday after students were harassed and molested during the annual fest of the college on February 6 .

The college had constituted a fact-finding committee with teachers and students from 17 departments of the college to look into the matter. The committee was supposed to submit its report on the matter on Saturday. However, they have sought more time till Monday.

The students demanded the budget of the college event from the principal for the previous year and this year, mostly related to the security arrangements during the fest.

Issuing a statement, the students’ body said, “The principal hasn’t shown us the budget. Moreover, the students wish to reiterate that they would want the women of other colleges to demand higher scrutiny from their administration to ensure that the educational institutions they visit are safer.”

A form prepared by the fact-finding committee is in two parts. The first part is for students of Gargi College or their friends who experienced sexual harassment during Reverie 2020. The second part is for students of the college to report gender bias that takes place in the college or around it.

The students had also demanded a written apology from the principal, Promila Kumar, or retraction of the statement of the principal made earlier to the media. Before the protest started on February 10, the principal had said there were no formal complaints made and the CCTV footage suggested no such case. Later, she issued a statement stating solidarity with the students.

Title: Gang uproots, flees with ATM in southeast Delhi
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

The men broke open the door frame of the kiosk to drag out the ATM

NEW DELHI: An unguarded ATM of a private bank at southeast Delhi’s Tughlaqabad was uprooted , with the criminals fleeing with the entire machine with Rs 57 ,500 in it. Police said the men had turned off the CCTV cameras in the kiosk but were caught fleeing in an SUV in another footage from a camera installed outside.

The role of a Haryana gang that has a similar modus operandi is suspected in the crime. The role of an insider has not been ruled out since the criminals seemed to be aware of the mechanism involved in sealing the ATM to the ground.

The incident happened early on Saturday. The crime was discovered on Saturday morning by a private company responsible for replenishing the cash in the machine, who found the ATM missing.

Based on their complaint, a case has now been registered. There was no security guard at the time of the incident. The men had also disabled the alarm system and broke open the door frame of the kiosk to drag out the ATM machine.

It was stuffed into the SUV through the rear door after which the men drove off. Police suspect that they might fled towards Suraj Kund.

The forensic examination of the kiosk revealed that the men used cutters to remove the screws that hold the machine to the floor.

According to the company who filed the complaint, the ATM didn’t have a huge sum of cash, had the gang struck the next day, they would have made away with approximately Rs 15 lakhs.

Police have recorded the statement of the private company responsible for the security of the ATM. CCTV footage of the area is being scanned to ascertain the identity of the men behind the heist and the vehicle they used to escape from the spot. The cops are also probing if there were any security lapses on the part of the company or the bank. The involvement of local criminals is also being verified.

Title: Cops seize 9.5kg ganja, arrest 4
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Kolhapur: In two separate raids conducted by police, four people were arrested for their alleged involvement in ganja trade in the district.

Police also seized 9.5 kg ganja from them. They suspect that the ganja was being supplied to Kolhapur from Sangli and Solapur districts.

The action was taken after a special workshop was recently organised for police officers in Kolhapur to tackle the narcotics nexus in the district.

In one incident reported from the jurisdiction of Rajarampuri police station, two suspects were nabbed for illegally selling ganja. They have been identified as Amit Shankar Devmare (21), a resident of Pandharpur and Manjunath Fakirappa Mandgodli (23), a resident of Siddharth Nagar, Gokul Shirgaon. Police have seized 1.5 kg ganja from them.

The duo were produced in a local court and remanded to five-day police custody.

In another incident reported from the jurisdiction of Gandhinagar police station, two suspects from Gadmudshingi were nabbed with 8 kg ganja. They have been identified as Ramesh Sambhaji Hirave (25), a resident of Gadmudshingi and Swapnil Balu Parale (25), a resident of Baba Nagar, Uchgaon.

The duo was presented in a local court and remanded to four-day police custody.

“The police department has initiated action against ganja nexus after the recent workshop organised at district headquarters,” said police sources.

Title: Man held for selling army canteen liquor
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Representative image

JODHPUR: In a joint operation by military intelligence and police, 54 liquor bottles were seized from a grocery shop near the defence area. The liquor had been obtained from the army canteen and was stocked up in the shop for sale at a premium. Police have arrested one person in the matter.

A police official from Mahamandir police station said that the raid was conducted after an input from the liaison unit of the Jodhpur Military Intelligence was obtained on Friday night. “The shop’s godown in Rasala area had 54 bottles of rum obtained from the army CSD canteen,” said the officer adding that the godown has also been seized following a suspicion on the quality of the grocery material stocked therein.

Police was also suspicious if the adulterated grocery items like ghee, tea and condiments were being supplied to various army units at the Jodhpur Military Station by the accused identified as Mahendra Singh. A team from the food safety department will visit the godown and will take samples of the goods stocked there.

According to the information, the accused has also been supplying condiments and other grocery items to the army for the past 20 years and has good contacts both in and ex-service men.

“Using these connections, he arranged liquor from the army canteen at a lower price and sells them in the open market in order to make quick bucks,” said the officer, adding that it would have to be investigated who all were involved in it and how long had he been selling the canteen liquor. A case under Section 19/54 of the Excise Act has been registered against the accused.

Title: No request from Shaheen Bagh to meet Amit Shah: Home ministry
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Amit Shah

NEW DELHI: The Union home ministry on Saturday clarified there was no formal request from the protesters at Shaheen Bagh to meet home minister Amit Shah even though there were reports that a section of protesters said they were ready to meet Shah to raise their concerns over the Citizenship Amendment Act.

“So far no meeting with home minister is scheduled on Sunday as there was no formal request from anyone,” said a home ministry official. Shah recently said he was ready to hold talks with the protesters.

The protesters, largely Muslims and including a large number of women, have been staging a sit-in against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), National Register of Citizens (NRC) and National Population Register (NPR) for the past two months.

They allegedly said the protest was "leaderless" and it was up to the home minister to decide who all he wanted to call for talks. "We are ready to meet the home minister. But he should make it clear how many people he wants to meet," Syed Ahmed Taseer, one of the organisers, said.

Mehrunnisa, who has been a regular at the protest, said the protesters would march to the home minister’s residence on Sunday.

“We would ask him to withdraw CAA-NRC-NPR," she said, adding that the protest would continue till their demand was met. In an interaction with Times Now earlier this week, Shah said anyone who wants to discuss issues related to CAA with him can seek time from his office. “(We) will give time within three days,” he added.

However, protesters have indicated that revocation of the CAA will be on the top of their charter of demands if they meet the home minister, which sinks possibility of a truce as Shah and other ministers have asserted that there won’t be any negotiations on the new law.

Title: ‘The heart remains matter of fact, brain adds the humour’
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Since it was formed in 2015, comedy-musical show Aisi Taisi Democracy (ATD) has been making Indians everywhere laugh uneasily at themselves and the state of affairs of the country. Engineered by the trio of Rahul Ram (bass player and vocalist for Indian Ocean), Varun Grover (stand -up comedian, writer and lyricist) and Sanjay Rajoura (comedian and social satirist), the unapologetically political comedy show packs a punch and has been garnering fans everywhere. Their song, Hum Kaagaz Nahin Dikhayenge , with words penned by Grover, has become an anthem for the ongoing anti-CAA protests in the country. This Sunday, the trio is headed to Times Litfest Bengaluru to give Bengalureans a taste of their bitingly funny show. Grover took time out for an email interview with TOI. Excerpts:

From 2015 to today, there’s a lot that has happened and is happening in the country. Do you feel validated with the idea of having started ATD at the right time? What do you love most about being a part of ATD?

No time is wrong time in India for political satire and that has been the case for the last 70 years in my opinion. The thing I love the most is that there are three of us on stage and hence, there’s a 33% chance of survival if anyone shoots at us.

As observers and commentators of the country’s goings on, how do you balance between when to stay funny and when to tell it like it is during your performances?

My top priority is to stay funny always. The balance comes from the craft – the most hardhitting things also require humour to be put across. So the heart remains matter of fact and brain adds the humour.

As a team, how has the journey been in terms of understanding each other and finding a common ground? How noisy and open are your brainstorming sessions?

We constantly disagree on what to joke about and how. Whenever we write a new show, we meet and jam and discuss ideas to find the various topics as well as the flow of the show. But the real feedback comes after we hit the road and we keep refining it. There have been a couple of noisy fights – but there is strong mutual respect and that helps a lot in seeing the intentions behind the feedback.

Hum Kaagaz Nahin Dikhayenge has become sort of an anthem in the Anti-CAA protests. What were you hoping to convey when you wrote the song? And when you see it being sung in different parts of the country, do you feel overwhelmed? Does it give you impetus to write fearlessly?

I was just trying to convey that the artist is not dead yet, even though the times are depressing and the regime is unrelenting in its violence. I wrote it a couple of days after cops stormed the library of Jamia (Milia Islamia) and attacked unarmed kids. I am overwhelmed not by people singing it but just by the general resilience shown by the peaceful protesters everywhere in India, in the face of police violence.

In times of political correctness and people taking offense easily, how do you retain a sense of humour as a political satirist?

I have great faith in our country’s capacity to love, forgive, and overcome the toughest of challenges thrown at us. When we got independent in 1947, most of the Western thinkers and experts predicted this country will come apart into a hundred provinces in a maximum of twenty years. They couldn’t imagine a country with so much diversity and such a huge size could find a national consciousness. And seventy years later here we are – our size and diversity as our strengths and one of the most well-defined national consciousness in our jan-gan-man. This gives me hope and hope gives me strength to continue speaking the truth through comedy.

As a trio, Aisi Taisi Democracy has travelled around the country. What is the general reaction you get from audiences everywhere? And have there been times when your shows have been cancelled because of the political nature of your content?

The response has been magnificent all over and no shows have been canned because of politics, except one college show at NIT, Allahabad because we were talking about sex education.

How does the team handle the success of a show? And what do you do when a show doesn’t go as well as expected?

Drink, in both cases.

Finally, because you are performing at a literature festival, who are your favourite writers?

Too many to count. But a short list would be – Manto, Manohar Shyam Joshi, Arundhati Roy, Ismat Chugtai, Uday Prakash, and Stephen King.

Title: Rajasthan: Body of Jhunjhunu man stuck in Baghdad since January 28
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Bhanwar Singh Shekhawat

KOTA: Body of a 45-year-old man from Nar Singhani village in Jhunjhunu district, who died on January 28, is since then stuck in Baghdad , where he worked, due to the complex formalities of the police and judiciary in Baghdad. The family of the deceased has been running from pillar to post to get his mortal remains but in vain.

While the state Congress general secretary Charmesh Sharma from Bundi was in communication with the Indian embassy in Baghdad to bring back eight other Indian youths from Bundi stuck in Iraq , the embassy officials informed him of the dead body of one Bhanwar Singh Shekhawat from Jhunjhunu district, kept in the mortuary of a hospital in Baghdad. Following that, Sharma submitted a memorandum in this connection to Bundi district collector, who on February 13, shot an email to personal secretary to the Prime Minister of India, requesting to initiate efforts to bring Shekhawat’s mortal remains back to his home in Rajasthan.

Bhanwar Singh Shekhawat had been working in Iraq’s capital Baghdad for last nine years and was to return home very soon due to his ill health. “I have also mailed a copy of the memorandum to the President’s office, Prime Minister’s office and the foreign ministry and have demanded high-level efforts to bring back Shekhawat’s mortal remains,” Charmesh Sharma told TOI. Depriving a body of last rites at home is a violation of international law and human rights that the Iraq government is committed to and now the government of India should immediately intervene in the matter and register protest to the ambassador of Iraq in India, Sharma said.

“We were informed of the death on the same day (on January 28) and we immediately fulfilled all the formalities to bring the body to India, including submission of the papers demanded by the concerned officials in Baghdad, depositing penalty of US $1,000 but many days have passed and yet the body has not been sent,” deceased Bhanwar Singh Shakhwat’s brother-in-law Vikram Singh told TOI on phone. Earlier, the judge of the local court in Baghdad refused to grant permission to send the body but following submission of required documents, he agreed for permission prior to submission of passport of deceased Shekhawat which was under the custody of local police, said Vikram Singh and added that when the police was contacted for the passport, they said to release the passport through court where the same judge reportedly again raised objection. “We wanted Bhanwar Singh to return earlier so that he could be given proper treatment as he had been ill, but we were suddenly informed of his demise on January 28,” he added.

“I have tweeted the complaint in this connection to concerned officials’ twitter handles and have spoken to the Indian embassy in Baghdad, but still the body has not reached here,” Singh added. The official at Indian embassy in Baghdad on phone said that they had no objection in sending the body and are ready to even bear the expenses for its transportation, but the judge at Baghdad court is raising objections at every step.

[Pic – copy of the letter by Bundi district collector to personal secretary to the Prime Minister of India with the request to bring Bhanwar Singh Shakhewat’s body to homeland

2. Deceased Bhanwar Singh, who had been working in Iraq for last 9 years and died on January 28 this year.]

Title: Close shave for Andhra Pradesh CM’s brother-in-law
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy

VIJAYAWADA: Chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy ’s brother-in-law Anil Kumar met with an accident after his vehicle fell into a ditch near Garikapadu village late on Friday night.

While timely deployment of airbags helped him escape unhurt, his staff sustained minor injuries.

According to police sources, the incident took place when Kumar was on his way to his home in Kadapa from Hyderabad.

After finding out about the incident, YSRC MLA and chief whip Samineni Udaybhanu reached the spot and rushed Kumar and his staff members to a private hospital in Vijayawada in another vehicle.

After receiving first aid, Anil left for his home in another private vehicle.

Chillakallu police explained that the incident took place as the driver failed to notice a diversion signage and went on to crash into a ditch.

Forty-nine-year-old Kumar is an evangelist and is married to Y S Jaganmohan Reddy’s sister YS Sharmila Reddy.

Title: ‘Govt working to increase job opportunities’
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Kochi: The state government aims to achieve comprehensive development in all sectors and young professionals have a decisive role in supporting the government to achieve the goal, said chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan. While inaugurating the Professional Students’ Summit 2020 at the Cochin University of Science and Technology ( Cusat ) on Saturday, he said that the youths will not have to go abroad in pursuit of jobs as Kerala will have plenty of opportunities in the coming years to meet the dreams of aspiring professionals.

“The investor’s meet held in Kochi recently has witnessed many major companies, the global giants which have no presence in Kerala in the past, expressing their willingness to invest in the state. The government has been taking necessary steps to promote investments. Kerala is a peaceful state with prosperity in all sectors. Besides literacy, the state is now a leader in imparting quality higher education. All these factors will persuade global companies to invest in Kerala, which in turn will increase job opportunities . We are on the path of creating a new Kerala and the support of the youngsters will be crucial,” Vijayan said.

Higher education minister K T Jaleel said the students pursuing professional courses need to put into practice the knowledge and skill they acquire but they do not get enough chances for that. “The state government is revising the educational system in such a way to address this issue with the help of Additional Skill Acquisition Programme ( Asap ). Innovative ideas of students will be promoted by the government through various programmes,” he said.

The summit was organized by the higher education department in association with Asap. Nearly 2,000 students pursuing professional courses in various institutions in the state participated in the summit.

Translational Health Science Technology Institute executive director Gagandeep Kang delivered the keynote address. Higher education secretary Usha Titus and Cusat vice-chancellor K N Madhusoodanan were among those present.

Title: Sangli cop arrested for stalking, out on bail
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Kolhapur: The Rajarampuri police arrested a police officer for allegedly sending lewd messages to a woman he met ten years ago. He was granted bail after being presented in the local court.

He has been arrested in a case of stalking (section 354 (d) of the Indian Penal Code), intentional insult to provoke breach of peace (section 504), criminal intimidation (section 506) and section 66 of the IT Act.

“The victim came in contact with the suspect in 2010 when she was preparing for competitive examinations. The two became friends and started meeting. The suspect expressed his love for the victim, who turned him down. He, however, continued to send her messages on the phone,” said a police officer.

The Rajarampuri police said the suspect allegedly threatened to beat up the victim’s husband if she did not leave him. “Unable to stop the suspect from harassing her, the woman lodged a complaint against him this week,” said an officer attached with Rajarampuri police station.

“Acting on the victim’s complaint, we immediately gathered information about the suspect and nabbed him. After completing interrogation, we arrested him. He was presented before the local court and was remanded in magistrate’s custody. He secured bail the same day,” he said.

The police said women and girls should not hesitate to contact the helpline numbers or nearby police stations if they are being harassed by any means.

“The victims can also contact the Nirbhaya team, a special squad that has been formed to look after such incidents. The police have shared the mobile numbers of these teams and they will rush to the victim’s aid after receiving a complaint,” the police said.

Title: MCOCA slapped on Bishnoi gang
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Kolhapur: Kolhapur police on Saturday invoked Maharashtra Control of Organised Crime Act ( MCOCA ) against the “007 Bishnoi” gang that was involved in attacking a police team at the Kini toll plaza last month.

Two members of the gang were injured during the encounter with Kolhapur police who finally succeeded in nabbing all three gang members.

Special inspector general Suhas Warke on Saturday approved the proposal of invoking MCOCA against the gang members. The proposal was put forward by the Peth Vadgaon police station last week.

They have been identified as Shamlal Govardhanram Puniya alias Bishnoi, the leader of the gang, Sriram Pacharam Bishnoi and Sravankumar Manoharlal Manju — all from Rajasthan.

Title: TS EAMCET 2020 to begin from May 4
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: The dates for Telangana State Engineering , Agriculture and Medical Common Entrance Test-2020 (TS EAMCET-2020) conducted by Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University Hyderabad (JNTUH) on behalf of Telangana State Council for Higher Education (TSCHE), were announced on Friday.

According to an official release for TS EAMCET-2020, the engineering exam will be held on May 4, 5 and 7 in the forenoon session of 10 am to 1 pm and the afternoon session of 3 pm to 6 pm. The agriculture and medical exam will be held on May 9 and May 11 in the two given sessions.

The notification of the exam will be issued on February 19 and submission of online applications will commence on February 21. The students will be able to download their hall tickets from the website from April 20 to May 1.

The registration fee for students appearing for the engineering exam would be Rs 400 (SC/ST and physically handicapped candidates) and Rs 800 (other candidates). The same follows for students appearing for Agriculture & Medical (AM) exam. Students appearing for both the exams will have to pay Rs 800 (SC/ST and physically handicapped candidates) and Rs 1,600 (other candidates).

Title: Rajasthan: Man gets life for abducting, raping minor girl in Jhalawar
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Representative image

Title: Delhi: Jammu and Kashmir resident alleges hotel denied room, OYO initiates probe
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Picture used for representational purpose only

NEW DELHI: A Delhi University student , who hails from Doda region of Jammu and Kashmir , has alleged that he was denied a room at an OYO hotel near DU North Campus which he had booked for his father and sister. The student claimed that the hotel authorities told him that they do not give rooms to residents of Afghanistan, Pakistan and Bangladesh. Despite him showing the necessary address proofs, they refused to allot the room claiming it to be a company policy.

OYO said that it will investigate the issue, and has temporarily suspended its partnership with the hotel.

The law student said that he had booked a room at the OYO-partnered hotel in Vijay Nagar on February 14. “The booking was from February 15 to 17 as my family was arriving on Saturday morning,” added the student who wished to remain anonymous.

“However, when I arrived at the hotel, the hotel management told me that they cannot provide room to people from Afghanistan, Pakistan and Bangladesh. Despite me telling them that I am from neither of these countries and I have multiple identification documents, they denied me the room as I was from J&K. They said that they were following OYO rooms policy,”claimed the student.

The OYO customer care executive, however, told him later that there was no such policy and the hotel denied him room on its own.

Despite many attempts, the hotel was not available for a comment.

However, when the student called the hotel in the evening, a staffer claimed that they were asked by police not to give rooms to people from J&K.

Delhi Police, however, said that no such order was issued by it. An OYO spokesperson later said: “OYO Hotels and Homes is committed to bringing quality living experiences to all our guests, irrespective of their religion, race, caste and gender. Any such action that tantamounts to discrimination is a serious violation of the basic principles of OYO’s ethos of doing business.”

The spokesperson added that they have initiated an inquiry into “the asset partner’s unilateral actions which resulted in the inconvenience caused to the customer. We have temporarily suspended operations with the asset partner. We sincerely apologise for this unfortunate experience.”

Title: Delhi: Barcoded entry passes for AAP workers at Arvind Kejriwal's swearing-in
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

More than 5,000 security men from different units will be deployed at the venue in the morning (File photo)

NEW DELHI: A multi-layer security will be in place around central Delhi for the swearing-in ceremony of CM-designate Arvind Kejriwal at Ramlila Maidan on Sunday. More than 5,000 securitymen from different units will be deployed at the venue in the morning.

Sources said the biggest challenge for police would be controlling the huge crowd that is expected to gather there since the ceremony is open to the public. A three-layer security cordon will be put in place to prevent anyone from reaching the areas allotted for VVIPs. Parking for cars will be allowed inside and behind Civic Centre.

Police said more than 12,000 AAP supporters and volunteers, who will be attending the programme, have been issued barcoded entry passes to verify their identity. Passes have been issued for each enclosure created for visitors. Police have advised the visitors to reach the venue early to avoid problems during security check. The area around the stage will be inaccessible to outsiders.

A team of spotters and a flying squad will be deployed near the ground to keep an eye on miscreants. Additional personnel will be deployed to prevent sporadic protests from breaking out. Senior party functionaries have been advised by police not to hold victory marches to the ground.

To facilitate VIP movement and avoid traffic congestion, no traffic will be allowed on Jawaharlal Nehru Marg from Guru Nanak Chowk to Kamala Market.

Commercial vehicles will be stopped from plying on JLN Marg from Rajghat to Ajmeri Gate, Deen Dayal Upadhyay Marg from ITO to Minto Road, Desh Bandhu Gupta Road from Paharganj Chowk and Y-Point Sheela Cinema to Ajmeri Gate, Asaf Ali Road, Shraddhanand Marg, Vivekananda Marg (Minto Road) Maharaja Ranjeet Singh Marg from Guru Nanak Chowk to Barakhamba Tolstoy Crossing.

Senior officers said because of VVIP movement, traffic is likely to be affected on Jawaharlal Nehru Marg, Asaf Ali Road, Bahadur Shah Zafar Marg, Deen Dayal Upadhyay Marg, Minto Road, Ranjeet Singh Marg and flyover, Desh Bandhu Gupta Road, Shraddhanand Marg, Ajmeri Gate side of New Delhi railway station and ITO.

Title: Visakhapatnam: Man stabs wife to death
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Representative image

VISAKHAPATNAM: A man, who is allegedly mentally disabled, killed his wife with a sharp-edged weapon in Amruthapuram village in Sabbavaram mandal on Friday night. The deceased was identified as Sarojani and the accused’s name is T Srinivas. The mother of three died on the spot.

According to sources, Srinivas has two acres of farmland and is involved in agriculture. He has been undergoing treatment for his mental disability for the past few months. On Friday night, Sarojani went to Surreddypalem along with her in-laws to attend prayers and returned at around 10 am.

After some time, Srinivas told his father that he had killed his wife. Srinivas’s father found his daughter-in-law in a pool of blood and informed Sarojani’s sister about the incident. By the time an ambulance reached the spot, the victim had died.

Title: Delhi high court seeks audit of private school on NDMC land
Content:
This story is from February 16, 2020

Delhi high court

NEW DELHI: Delhi high court has ordered an audit and inspection of a school on government land in Chanakyapuri.

A bench of Chief Justice D N Patel and Justice C Hari Shankar took a grim view of the allegations that the private school (playschool and pre-primary) running on the land leased out by New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) in 2012 was ignoring norms specified under the Right to Education (RTE) Act.

“So far as the allegations regarding violation of the Right to Education Act and non-holding of inspections and audits of the school are concerned, respondents shall ensure proper implementation of the Act, and carry out inspections and audits,” the bench told NDMC and the Centre’s L&DO. It added that the government authorities must carry out necessary audits and proper verification with respect to the school.
